0.title: Man who pushed wife in front of moving train in Maharashtra arrested
0.article_body: A man who killed his wife by pushing her in front of a moving train at the Vasai Road Railway Station in Maharashtra on Monday was arrested in Thane. After pushing his wife, the man ran away from the platform with his two children. The incident was caught on a CCTV camera installed at the platform of the station.

1.title: Gujarat BJP chief is going to be removed soon, according to sources: Kejriwal
1.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said that BJP in Gujarat is "terrified" because of AAP. "According to the sources, soon, Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil is going to be removed. Is the BJP so afraid?" Kejriwal tweeted. CM Kejriwal and his deputy Manish Sisodia arrived in poll-bound Gujarat for a two-day visit on Monday.

2.title: Delhi man arrested for creating fake social media profile of woman
2.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested by Delhi's Dwarka Police for allegedly creating a fake social media profile of a woman after she ignored his messages. The accused, Mahaveer Singh, used to then send obscene messages to the woman, police said. Notably, Mahaveer's brother used to reside in the same building as the complainant around eight-nine years ago, police added

3.title: UP Police raid illegal hookah bar in Greater Noida, 25 arrested
3.article_body: UP Police raided a bar at a mall in Greater Noida for allegedly serving hookah to customers without permission. "We have busted an illegal hookah bar at Lucifer restaurant and bar. Over 15 hookahs and pipes have been seized from the property. We have apprehended 25 persons," said Deputy Commissioner of Police, Greater Noida.

4.title: Real B'wood found in dark alleys, those who make it get into drugs: Vivek
4.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri recently shared an "inside story" on Bollywood on social media, writing, "What you see is not Bollywood. Real Bollywood is found in its dark alleys." He further wrote, "Those who find some success but not the real one get into drugs, alcohol...Some success is the most dangerous one. You are in showbiz without any income and power."

5.title: Actor Aayush Sharma announces next film, shares first look
5.article_body: Actor Aayush Sharma took to Instagram and shared his first look from his upcoming film. The film is yet to be titled and the name of the director is yet to be revealed. "If I provide all the details now, it will ruin all the fun," Aayush captioned it. The actor further revealed that the film will release in 2023.

6.title: There's no place at the top, Sanju can stake claim at no. 5 or 6: Kaif
6.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has said Sanju Samson's six-hitting ability can help him stake a claim down the batting order in India's playing XI. "There's no place at the top. You have KL Rahul [and] Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli will come and Suryakumar Yadav is also there," stated Kaif. Samson batted at number six in the Zimbabwe ODIs.

7.title: Delhi likely to see very light rainfall with overcast skies: IMD
7.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted very light rainfall with overcast skies in Delhi today. The national capital could also see strong gusty winds with a speed of 35-45km/hr. According to Met officials, the maximum temperature may hover around 35°C, while the minimum will be around 27°C. Delhi’s air quality (92) was in the satisfactory category this morning.

8.title: I respect SRK a lot, can never make fun of him: Munawar Faruqui
8.article_body: Comedian Munawar Faruqui has said that he respects Shah Rukh Khan a lot and can never make fun of him. "Even after so much name and fame, he has a very distinct attraction. You cannot help but admire him," he added. Calling Shah Rukh a sharp and witty man, Munawar said, "He has an amazing hold on stage. It's fantastic."

9.title: Obviously a difficult feeling: Harry Styles on trolling against Olivia
9.article_body: Singer Harry Styles opened up about the trolling against his girlfriend Olivia Wilde. "It's obviously a difficult feeling to feel like being close to me means you're at the ransom of a corner of Twitter," he said. He added, "I just wanted to sing. I didn't want to get into it if I was going to hurt people like that."

10.title: Shivnath Express train derails in Chhattisgarh, no casualty reported
10.article_body: The Shivnath Express train, which was heading to Nagpur, got derailed in Chhattisgarh’s Dongargarh this morning. The train was on its way from Gondia station to Itwari in Nagpur. The incident took place early morning at 3:42 am. According to an official, there has been no casualty or injury reported as the train was travelling at quite a slow pace.

11.title: Congolese woman held in Delhi for cheating Pune resident of ₹12.3 lakh
11.article_body: A Congolese woman, wanted by Pimpri Chinchwad Police in a case of cyber fraud since 2021, was arrested upon landing at Delhi airport. She allegedly cheated a 40-year-old woman of ₹12.3 lakh through an online dating portal by using a fake profile of a US-based surgeon. A Look Out Circular was issued against her and she was detained in Delhi.

12.title: Jhunjhunwala's Rare Enterprises-backed IKS Health to file for IPO: Reports
12.article_body: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala’s investment firm Rare Enterprises-backed IKS Health is set to file draft papers with the Securities and Exchange Board of India in September for floating initial public offering (IPO) soon, reports said. IKS Health is reportedly looking to raise ₹2,500 crore via the issuance of 15% equity. Rare Enterprises hold a nearly 54% stake in IKS Health.

13.title: Enjoyed calling Anil nanaji after arrival of Sonam's baby: Sanjay Kapoor
13.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor, brother of Anil Kapoor, said in an interview that he enjoyed calling Anil 'nanaji' after the arrival of Sonam Kapoor's baby. "He laughed and said grandfather sounds cooler," Sanjay added. He further said Sonam and her husband Anand Ahuja were 'ecstatic'. Sonam and Anand became parents on August 20.

14.title: Missed opportunity for scene with Pankaj in 'Criminal Justice 3': Purab
14.article_body: Actor Purab Kohli stated that it was a missed opportunity for him to get a scene with actor Pankaj Tripathi in their upcoming web show 'Criminal Justice: Adhura Sach'. "I mentioned it to director Rohan Sippy and the writer too. Requested them for at least one scene where I get to act with Pankaj...but that didn't happen sadly," he added.

15.title: Losing Shaheen before Asia Cup is a 'big' setback: Pak head coach Saqlain
15.article_body: Pakistan head coach Saqlain Mushtaq said losing pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi before the Asia Cup is a "big setback" for his team. "The injury [to his right knee ligament] is unfortunate," added Saqlain. "Shaheen's injury [is a] big relief for the Indian top-order [batters]," ex-Pakistan captain Waqar Younis had earlier tweeted. India will face Pakistan on August 28 in Dubai.

16.title: 4 earthquakes hit Jammu and Kashmir in less than 6 hours
16.article_body: As many as four earthquakes hit Jammu and Kashmir in less than six hours on Tuesday. The first earthquake occurred at 2.20 am and its epicentre was 61 kilometres east of the Katra area in Jammu, officials said. The second earthquake of 2.6-magnitude on the Richter scale occurred at 3.21 am, 9.5 kilometres northeast of Doda in Jammu.

17.title: 6 of family, including 11-yr-old, killed as car collides with bus in Tamil Nadu
17.article_body: At least six members of a family, including an 11-year-old girl, were killed in a road accident near Attur in Tamil Nadu's Salem, police said. The car they were travelling in collided with a bus on Salem-Chennai National Highway, police added. As many as 11 people had gone to attend the funeral of one of their relatives, police stated.

18.title: A heavy price would be paid for invading Taiwan: President Tsai amid China threat
18.article_body: Amid the threat of an invasion by China, Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen said, "A heavy price will be paid for invading or attempting to invade Taiwan, and it will be strongly condemned by the international community." "What we have to do is to let the enemy understand that Taiwan has the determination and preparation to defend the country," she added.

19.title: US urges citizens to leave Ukraine, says Russia planning fresh strikes
19.article_body: The US has said that Russia is planning to step up its attacks on Ukraine's civilian infrastructure and government buildings in the coming days. The US also urged its citizens to leave Ukraine immediately. This comes as Kyiv banned public celebrations to mark Ukraine's Independence Day, which falls on August 24, citing a heightened threat of attack from Russia.

20.title: BJP's 'Operation Lotus' in Delhi failed for 2nd time: AAP MLA
20.article_body: AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj on Tuesday said that BJP has toppled several elected governments in the country under "Operation Lotus". "BJP's 'Operation Lotus' in Delhi failed for the second time," Bharadwaj added. "We will expose BJP in such a way that it will not dare to topple any government in any state in future," he stated.

21.title: IAF's Mi-35 attack helicopter makes emergency landing in Rajasthan
21.article_body: An Indian Air Force (IAF) Mi-35 helicopter made an emergency landing in a farm in Rajasthan's Hanumangarh district after it developed a technical snag on Tuesday. "The helicopter made the emergency landing due to a technical snag. Its crew members are safe," Station House Officer of Sangaria police station said.

22.title: Congress releases 'Mile kadam-Jude vatan' tagline for its Bharat Jodo Yatra
22.article_body: Ahead of Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra, which is scheduled to start on September 7 from Kanniyakumari, senior party leaders released the logo, tagline and pamphlet of the campaign in Delhi. The tagline reads 'Mile kadam-Jude vatan'. The five-month-long yatra is scheduled to cover a distance of 3,500 kilometres over 12 states. The party has also launched a website.

23.title: PIL filed in Calcutta HC seeking ban on Aamir's 'Laal Singh Chaddha'
23.article_body: A Public Interest Litigation (PIL) has been filed in Calcutta High Court against Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' calling for a ban on the film in West Bengal. The PIL cites peace disorder stating that the Army is not represented properly in the film. It also calls for police personnel to be posted outside theatres if ban is not placed.

24.title: Assam court summons Sisodia over defamation case filed by CM Himanta
24.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has been summoned to appear before an Assam court on September 29 over a defamation case filed by Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma. Sarma filed the case after Sisodia accused him of corruption. Sisodia had alleged that the Assam government gave contracts to firms linked to Sarma's family to produce PPE kits at high prices.

25.title: Woman dies days after giving birth by C-section at Hyderabad hospital
25.article_body: A woman with hearing and speech issues died days after she gave birth to a baby through a caesarean procedure at a hospital in Hyderabad. The woman's family members have filed a complaint against the hospital. She gave birth on August 9 and suffered complications after that. She was readmitted to the hospital, where she died on August 20.

26.title: 'Convicts' release shows they were reformed,' says officer who probed Bilkis Bano case
26.article_body: The release of 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano case shows they were reformed, said retired IPS officer Vivek Dube, who investigated the case. Dube, who was then the Joint Director at the CBI, added, "The protest by a section of people and media...have no basis. They are being revengeful, which is against the spirit of the Constitution of India."

27.title: US President's Chief Medical Advisor Fauci to step down after 50 yrs of govt service
27.article_body: White House Chief Medical Advisor Dr Anthony Fauci announced he will step down from his role in December, after over 50 years of government service. He will also step down from his role as head of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID). "I am very proud of our many accomplishments," said Dr Fauci.

28.title: ABVP protests near Hyd junior college, calls for fee regulatory law
28.article_body: Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP) held a protest in front of Hyderabad's Sri Chaitanya Junior College on Monday. Protesting against Telangana government's "soft attitude" against erring private junior colleges, the activists said that the state government should introduce a fee regulatory law for private colleges. ABVP also called for bandh of all junior colleges in Telangana on Tuesday.

29.title: ‘Bharat Jodo Yatra’ could lead to violence: BS Yediyurappa
29.article_body: Former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa cautioned Congress against holding 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', asserting that it could lead to violence and unrest. "On the pretext of protesting, holding a padayatra is uncalled for. If the proposed padayatra is held, lakhs of people are likely to assemble which could spell a disaster. Siddaramaiah will be solely responsible for the problem," Yediyurappa said.

30.title: Karnataka govt to install 'unicorn' structure in Bengaluru
30.article_body: The Karnataka government announced on Monday that it would put up a 'unicorn' structure in Bengaluru to mark the city being home to the largest number of start-ups and unicorns in the country. According to the Crunchbase website, India saw 53 start-ups becoming unicorns between 2011 and 2022 and of these, 19 are said to be based in Bengaluru.

31.title: Billionaire Adani's empire may spiral into debt trap, is deeply overleveraged: Report
31.article_body: Indian billionaire Gautam Adani's empire is "deeply overleveraged" and risks spiralling into a debt trap and possibly a default "in the worst-case scenario", a report by a Fitch Group unit has said. It also warned that potential strong competition for market dominance between Adani Group and Mukesh Ambani's Reliance may lead to 'unwise' financial decisions.

32.title: Hindi cinema won't die, Bollywood not lacking anything: Manoj Bajpayee
32.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee has stated in an interview that too much is being made out of Bollywood's bad phase, adding that Hindi cinema will not die. "It will course-correct and come back to its normal self," the actor said. On being asked if Bollywood is lacking something to attract audience, Manoj said, "We don't lack anything. We've been entertaining for...decades."

33.title: Only player who's probably disappointed with Zimbabwe ODIs is Rahul: Ajay Jadeja
33.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja has said the only cricketer who is probably disappointed with the recently-concluded Zimbabwe ODIs is KL Rahul. "He [Rahul] didn't get to bat enough and he has no one else to blame but himself," added Jadeja. Rahul scored a total of 31 runs in his two innings in the three-match series.

34.title: 2015 silver medallist Saina enters pre-quarters at World Championships 2022
34.article_body: Ex-world number one Saina Nehwal beat Hong Kong's Cheung Ngan Yi 21-19, 21-9 in the first round at World Championships 2022 in Tokyo on Tuesday. The 2015 silver medallist will now play her pre-quarterfinal match after her second round opponent Nozomi Okuhara withdrew from the tournament. Saina is the only Indian shuttler left in the women's singles category.

35.title: Disgraceful, condemnable: Mayawati on T'gana BJP MLA's remarks on Prophet
35.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati termed Telangana BJP MLA Raja Singh's remarks against Prophet Muhammad as "disgraceful and utterly condemnable". "Is it not the responsibility of...BJP leadership to keep its people restrained and controlled to maintain peace...besides saving the country's image from getting hurt abroad," she tweeted. Singh was arrested today following massive protests by people in Hyderabad.

36.title: Amit Shah calling T'gana CM 'anti-farmer' is joke of the century: KTR
36.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah calling Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao "anti-farmer" is the joke of the century, Telangana Rashtra Samithi Working President KT Rama Rao tweeted. "Who copied KCR's brainchild "Rythu Bandhu"...rebranded it as PM-Kisan?" KTR added. "Who apologised to the farmers after facing their wrath over the [repealed] farm laws, after losing 700 valuable lives?" he wrote.

37.title: 50-yr-old Mumbai man cheated of ₹17.3 lakh in bitcoin investment fraud
37.article_body: A 50-year-old man from Mumbai, Colin Buthello, lodged a complaint with Nehru Nagar police alleging he was defrauded of ₹17.30 lakh after investing in a bogus bitcoin trading company. According to police, the fraudster promised returns as high as 150%, after which the victim kept investing bigger amounts. However, the company's web link became dysfunctional and the fraudster stopped responding.

38.title: IndusInd Bank digital banking units launched in Punjab, Tamil Nadu
38.article_body: IndusInd Bank has launched two digital banking units to accelerate the reach of digital banking services. The units have been opened in Punjab and Tamil Nadu and will offer several "Digital, Do It Yourself" services, the bank said. The services include instant opening of savings and current accounts, instant processing of personal and business loans, and KYC updates, among others.

39.title: BJP suspends Telangana MLA Raja Singh after his arrest over Prophet remarks
39.article_body: BJP's Telangana MLA T Raja Singh was suspended by the party hours after he was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly making derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad. The party gave Singh a show-cause notice of 10 days, asking him to explain why he should not be expelled. An FIR was registered against him after protests erupted in Hyderabad on Monday.

40.title: Haarsh and I always wanted baby girl but God had his own plan: Bharti on son
40.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh said that she and her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa wanted a baby girl from the beginning. "But God had his own plan and blessed us with a baby boy...I can picturise that someday when I come back from work after a...tiring day, he will take care of me," she added after watching a video on a reality show.

41.title: Starved myself of sex, food while filming for 'Silence': Andrew Garfield
41.article_body: Speaking about method acting, actor Andrew Garfield has said, "There [have] been a lot of misconceptions about what method acting is...it's not about being an a*****e to everyone on set." Recalling his experience while filming for Martin Scorsese's 'Silence', he said, "I had some pretty wild, trippy experiences from starving myself of sex and food at that time."

42.title: Disappointed with the way India played ODI series vs Zimbabwe: Maninder
42.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Maninder Singh said he is "disappointed" with the manner in which Team India played their recently concluded ODI series against Zimbabwe. "You should have taken some more challenge...This was an opportunity to test your opening batters in difficult conditions and then test your bowlers when the conditions become good for batting," added Maninder. India defeated Zimbabwe 3-0.

43.title: 4 friends returning from birthday party die in road accident in Gurugram
43.article_body: Four people were killed and another was injured after their car was hit from behind by a bus when the former was taking a u-turn near Khetawas village in Gurugram on Monday. The four deceased, Aavin, Abhishek, Jeshnaw and Paras, were friends and out of them two were students, police said. Notably, the deceased were returning from a birthday party.

44.title: Video shows man using chip implanted in his hand to unlock Tesla car in the US
44.article_body: A man from the US has shared a video of him using a small chip implanted in his hand to unlock his Tesla car. "The whole idea was that I would have...my car key in my right hand," Brandon Dalaly said. The chip can also be used to store data and cryptocurrencies and make credit card transactions in the future.

45.title: Don't have any problem doing 'Bigg Boss 16' with Rajeev Sen: Charu Asopa
45.article_body: Actress Charu Asopa has revealed that she has been approached by the makers of 'Bigg Boss' for the upcoming season, however, she added that she does not know if her husband Rajeev Sen has been contacted. This comes after the duo have filed for divorce. "I don't have any problem doing a show with him. Work is work," she added.

46.title: KCR was on tour with Kejriwal & Mann, can’t be coincidence: Amit Malviya
46.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya has linked Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao and TRS MLC K Kavitha with the Delhi excise policy case. "It can’t be mere coincidence...K Kavitha’s father KCR was recently on a tour with Arvind Kejriwal and Bhagwant Mann," Malviya tweeted. "Now her name figures in Kejriwal liquor scam for...facilitating bribe of ₹4.5 crore to Sisodia," he added.

47.title: BJP hates Prophet, Muslims: Owaisi on BJP MLA Raja Singh's remarks
47.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday condemned Telangana BJP MLA T Raja Singh's alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad and said, "BJP hates Prophet Muhammad and Muslims. They want to destroy...social fabric of India." He added that the PM and BJP should react if they don't support the remarks. "Fight with us politically but not like this," he further said.

48.title: Man forges Thane Police Commissioner's signature to run security agency, held
48.article_body: A man, Shivam Lalsaheb Pandey, was arrested for allegedly forging Thane Police Commissioner Jai Jeet Singh's signature and making a fake permit to operate a security agency, an official said. A police team on Sunday raided Pandey's security agency premises. He showed a fake permit, which showed it was valid up to February 26, 2027, inspector SS Nimbalkar said.

49.title: MTDC to conduct guided tours in Pune, Mumbai during Ganesh Chaturthi
49.article_body: In a bid to popularise Ganesh Chaturthi among foreigners and non-Maharashtrians, the Maharashtra Tourism Development Corporation (MTDC) is planning to conduct guided tours in Pune and Mumbai this year. Tourists and devotees opting for the tours in Pune will be taken to locations including Kasba Ganpati, Kesari Wada and Tambdi Jogeshwari, an official said. The tours can be booked online.

50.title: Krunal Pandya ruled out of Royal London One-Day Cup due to groin injury
50.article_body: Indian all-rounder Krunal Pandya, who was playing for English county side Warwickshire, has been ruled out of the ongoing Royal London One-Day Cup after sustaining a groin injury. The 31-year-old picked up the injury while scoring 37 during Warwickshire's match against Nottinghamshire on August 17. Krunal played five Royal London Cup matches, scoring 134 runs at an average of 33.50.

51.title: Hyd flyover's inauguration postponed amid protests over Raja Singh's remarks
51.article_body: The inauguration of Hyderabad's Chandrayangutta flyover, which was scheduled to be held on Tuesday, has been postponed to August 27 amid protests in the city over BJP MLA Raja Singh's remarks against Prophet Muhammad. The extension of the flyover was scheduled to be inaugurated by AIMIM President Asaduddin Owaisi, Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao and AIMIM floor leader Akbaruddin Owaisi.

52.title: Will not accept any cabinet post if Liz Truss becomes PM: Sunak
52.article_body: British Prime Ministerial candidate Rishi Sunak has hinted he wouldn't accept any cabinet post offered by Liz Truss if she wins the election."[Cabinet ministers] really need to agree with the big things," he said, adding, "I wouldn't want to end up in a situation like that again." Sunak had resigned as Finance Minister over his differences with PM Boris Johnson.

53.title: Deceased govt employee's sister not entitled to job if wife is alive: HC
53.article_body: Allahabad High Court ruled that a deceased government employee's sister cannot be entitled to a job on compassionate grounds if his wife is still alive and has claimed for the appointment. HC was hearing a petition filed by a woman whose father was a 'safai karamchari'. After his death, the petitioner's brother was granted the appointment on compassionate grounds.

54.title: Cache of assault weapons recovered along India-Pakistan border in Punjab
54.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) recovered a cache of assault weapons along the India-Pakistan border in Punjab on Tuesday. Three AK series rifles with six magazines, two M3 submachine guns with four magazines and two pistols were unearthed in the state's Ferozepur sector in the early hours, officials said. The weapons are suspected to have been smuggled in from Pakistan.

55.title: Nawazuddin's first look from 'Haddi' out; social media users say 'unrecognisable'
55.article_body: Nawazuddin Siddiqui's first look from the film 'Haddi' was shared by Zee Studios on Instagram on Tuesday. Reacting to his post, social media users said he is "unrecognisable" in the motion poster and wrote, "Is that Nawaz?" and "Nawaz sir amazingly disguised." "Filming begins, releasing in 2023," Zee Studios wrote in the post.

56.title: SC criticises Baba Ramdev, says 'How can he accuse doctors as if they are killers?'
56.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday pulled up Baba Ramdev for ridiculing doctors and allopathy while praising Patanjali products. The CJI said, "How can he say all this...accusing all the doctors as if they are killers. He cannot abuse doctors and other systems of medicine." The court added, "What is the guarantee what he is advocating will cure people of all diseases?"

57.title: People said 'Oh man, kya kaam kiya hai', it gives me hope: Rohit on 'Mumbai..'
57.article_body: Actor Rohit Bose Roy, while talking about 'Mumbai Saga' said that people said, "Oh man, kya kaam kiya hai (What performance have you given)". "When 'Forensic' was released people said, 'We wanted to see more of Rohit in the film'. These kinds of things give me hope that at least the audience wants to see me," he added.

58.title: I delivered 'Gangubai...', so who's having last laugh: Alia on trolling
58.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has stated that the only way she can shut down trolls is through her movies. "I delivered a film like 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. So who's having the last laugh? At least until I deliver my next flop," the actress added. She further said that feeling bad is a small price to pay for the work she does.

59.title: No 'Amrit Mahotsav' can be successful without Jawaharlal Nehru: Gehlot
59.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday said that PM Narendra Modi-led government does not want to tell the truth about history. "No 'Amrit Mahotsav' can be successful without Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru. There is no mention of Indira Gandhi in their regime," Gehlot added. "There were many great freedom fighters but they don't talk about them," he stated.

60.title: Leopard seen at DRDO facility in Pune; forest dept teams deployed
60.article_body: Teams from the forest department were deployed after a leopard was sighted inside the campus of a research and development facility of the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) in Pune on Tuesday. A perimeter has been secured by security personnel, officials said. "Rescue operation for the leopard is currently on," Deputy Conservator of Forests (Pune division) Rahul Patil said.

61.title: China changes 'Minions: The Rise of Gru' ending, shows villain being jailed
61.article_body: Chinese censors changed the ending of animated film 'Minions: The Rise of Gru' for domestic release, as per viewers in the country. According to posts shared on Chinese microblogging site Weibo, an addendum shows main character Wild Knuckles being caught by police and serving 20 years in jail. The international version shows Wild Knuckles faking his death to evade capture.

62.title: RBL Bank shares rise 6% after Board approves ₹3,000 cr fundraise
62.article_body: RBL Bank shares rose more than 6% following its Board of Directors' approval to raise funds up to ₹3,000 crore through the issuance of debt securities on private placement. The bank's stock was trading at ₹104.25 at 2:05 pm, a 6.1% rise from the previous close. RBL Bank also sold 17.78% stake in Kilburn Engineering between May and August 2022.

63.title: Gold prices rise a day after hitting near one-month low
63.article_body: Gold prices rose on Tuesday in the international markets driven by a little pullback in the US dollar. It had hit its lowest since July 27 at $1,727.01 on Monday. Gold contracts were trading 0.2% higher on the Multi-Commodity Exchange (MCX) at ₹51,174 per 10 grams at 9:44 am. Spot gold had risen 0.2% at $1,738.90 per ounce.

64.title: Mumbai hotel gets threat call; caller says 4 bombs placed, asks for ₹5 cr
64.article_body: A man called The Lalit Hotel in Mumbai's Vile Parle East and said four bombs had been planted in hotel premises, police said. Police added that accused said he will give them locations and tell them how to diffuse bombs if they pay him ₹5 crore. The caller also said the family of the General Manager  was on their target.

65.title: SRK wanted to climb on top of the train's chimney: Farah on 'Chaiyya...'
65.article_body: Discussing the song 'Chaiyya Chaiyya' from 'Dil Se', choreographer Farah Khan said it was shot on top of a train, as they weren't permitted to shoot at Ooty railway station. "There was no...safety...I would say...I'd take extra dancers...in case some...fell off," added Farah. "SRK wanted to climb on...top of the train's chimney...We had to pull him down!" she stated.

66.title: 17-yr-old UP girl shouts for help in traffic jam, police save her from traffickers
66.article_body: A 17-year-old girl was saved from human traffickers after she raised an alarm on seeing police officers in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. The girl was sitting in an SUV with human traffickers, who'd allegedly bought her from her uncle, and they were stuck in a traffic jam. A sub-inspector said that they surrounded the SUV after the girl cried for help.

67.title: Bangladesh to cut school, office hours to save power
67.article_body: Bangladesh will close schools for one more day each week and reduce office hours to ease an electricity shortage, Cabinet Secretary Khandker Anwarul Islam said. Last month, the South Asian country began daily two-hour power cuts. Bangladesh has shut down all 10 of its diesel power plants after Russia's invasion of Ukraine drove up the cost of imported fuel.

68.title: Spring in my step: Harshal Patel shares videos while recovering at NCA
68.article_body: India pacer Harshal Patel, who is undergoing rehabilitation for the rib injury he suffered last month, has shared videos of his training at the NCA. The 31-year-old, who can be seen sprinting in the videos, wrote, "Spring in my step." Harshal missed the white-ball series against West Indies and Zimbabwe and is also set to miss the upcoming Asia Cup.

69.title: UP govt to build Bankey Bihari temple corridor for devotees’ convenience: Minister
69.article_body: The UP government will build a dedicated corridor soon for the smooth movement of devotees from the Yamuna riverbank to Mathura’s Bankey Bihari temple, state minister Laxmi Narayan Chaudhary said. The corridor can accommodate over 50,000 devotees at a time. Devotees, after taking a dip in the Yamuna, can directly reach the temple via the corridor, the minister added.

70.title: Unknown man enters AIIMS ICU to click selfies with Raju Srivastava: Reports
70.article_body: An unidentified man entered the ICU in AIIMS Delhi to click selfies with comedian Raju Srivastava, according to reports. After the incident, guards have been deployed outside the ICU, the reports added. The comedian is undergoing treatment after suffering a heart attack on August 10 and is currently on ventilator support.

71.title: I've heard of Rajesh Khanna but I and the generation after don't care: Vijay
71.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda said that he is very happy to be "forgotten". "I have understood that nobody remembers," he said, adding, "I have known actors who are worshipped by the country...Rajesh Khanna, I have heard stories of him. But, me and the generation after are not aware of this or don't care. For them, now it is about somebody else."

72.title: Will consider making Mumbai-Pune Expressway 8 lanes, says Fadnavis
72.article_body: In response to a demand by NCP leader Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Monday said, "We'll check the feasibility of making the Mumbai-Pune Expressway eight lanes." This comes after former MLC Vinayak Mete died in a car crash on the expressway. Fadnavis added that a request for the same will be put before state CM Eknath Shinde.

73.title: Pune's Ganesh mandal denied permission to depict Afzal Khan's killing
73.article_body: Pune's Kothrud Police denied permission to Sangam Mitra Mandal to depict Afzal Khan's killing during ten-day Ganesh Chaturthi festival starting August 31. "In the past, law and order issues...reported due to such tableaux," police said. A riot broke out in Sangli in 2009 over a poster on the killing of Khan, Kutub Shah of Bijapur's lieutenant, by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.

74.title: Ryan Reynolds posts about Indian eatery in UK, says 'Best Indian food in Europe'
74.article_body: Actor Ryan Reynolds posted a picture of a flyer of an Indian restaurant in UK's Cheshire on his Instagram story and wrote, "Best Indian Food in Europe." Reynolds, who has over 44 million followers on Instagram, has been spending time in the UK having taken over ownership of the National League football club Wrexham AFC.

75.title: Let me stay away from Twitter: Kapil on boycott 'Raksha Bandhan' trend
75.article_body: Reacting to the boycott trends on Twitter, actor-comedian Kapil Sharma said such trends keep coming. When asked about the boycott trend against Akshay Kumar’s film ‘Raksha Bandhan’, Kapil replied, “I’ve not heard of any such boycott against his films.” “Please let me stay away from the world of Twitter, it took a lot to come out of that,” he added.

76.title: BJP expels leader beaten by wife after getting caught with female friend
76.article_body: BJP leader Mohit Sonkar, who was publically beaten by his wife and in-laws with slippers after getting caught with a female friend in his car in Kanpur, has been expelled from the party. BJP's state general secretary Govind Narayan Shukla said that a letter in this regard has been sent to the party's state chief and other officials.

77.title: Former Apple car engineer, accused of stealing trade secrets, pleads guilty in US
77.article_body: Former Apple engineer Xiaolang Zhang pled guilty to stealing trade secrets while working on the company's car project between 2015 and 2018. Zhang faces up to 10 years in US prison and a $250,000 fine, as per CNBC. In 2018, Apple accused Zhang of downloading internal company files relating to its secretive car project, including circuit boards and a server.

78.title: Video shows soldiers beating up civilians in Srinagar, J&K Police file case
78.article_body: J&K Police registered a case on Monday after a video clip went viral purportedly showing soldiers beating up civilians in Srinagar, PTI reported. The Chinar Corps unit of the Army is ascertaining the authenticity of the video clip. "Prima facie it appears to be an old video, deliberately posted to tarnish the image of Armed Forces," an Army official said.

79.title: BBMP employee transfers ₹14 lakh public funds to friend, both arrested
79.article_body: Bengaluru Police have arrested a BBMP employee and his female friend after he allegedly transferred ₹14 lakh public money to her account. The incident came to light after a BBMP official filed complaint against Prakash for not submitting records of the annual audit. According to police, Prakash's friend Kanchana used the money to buy gold and live a luxurious life.

80.title: Why should I break it? I worked hard for it: Cezanne on being called Anurag
80.article_body: Actor Cezanne Khan, who portrayed Anurag Basu in 'Kasautii Zindagii Kay', has said that people keep telling him that he needs to break the tag. "But why? Maine mehnat kari hai uss character pe (I worked hard on that character)," he added. The actor further said that the part opened many doors for him and brought him love from audience.

81.title: B'luru's Mojocare raises $20 mn led by Facebook Co-founder's firm
81.article_body: Bengaluru-based health-tech startup Mojocare has raised $20.6 million in Series A funding round led by Facebook Co-founder Eduardo Saverin's VC firm B Capital Group. Others who participated in the round include Mojocare's existing investors Chiratae Ventures, Sequoia India's Surge, and Better Capital. Mojocare helps its consumers with issues including reproductive health and fertility.

82.title: Mexican journalist killed hours after posting about disappeared students
82.article_body: A Mexican journalist was shot dead on Monday in southern Mexico, authorities said. Fredid "Fredy" Roman was killed hours after posting a column on the alleged involvement of local politicians in the disappearance of 43 students in 2014, which investigators called a "state crime" last week. At least 18 other journalists have been killed in Mexico this year.

83.title: Sonali Phogat posted a video of herself hours before her death in Goa
83.article_body: In her last Instagram post, hours before her death, TikTok star and BJP leader Sonali Phogat had shared a video of herself sporting a pink turban. Phogat had passed away due to a heart attack in Goa on Monday night. She had gone to Goa with some of her employees, according to reports.

84.title: Sounds 'ridiculous' but we should've won: Klopp after loss vs Man Utd
84.article_body: Talking about Manchester United's 2-1 win against Liverpool, the latter's manager Jurgen Klopp said, "We should have won this game, I know it sounds ridiculous but that is how I saw it." "I am concerned about our situation...We are in a tricky situation injury wise," added Klopp. "Their second goal is hard to take, it was offside," he stated.

85.title: In a first, Tripura launches 24x7 national highway patrol service
85.article_body: Tripura CM Manik Saha on Monday launched the state's first-ever 24x7 national highway patrol vehicle service in a bid to reduce road accidents. "Drunk drivers will be identified as patrol vehicles will be equipped with speedometers, breath analysers, etc," he said. Moreover, he said that there's an 8% rise in road accidents and a 2.5% rise in fatalities every month.

86.title: Proud my 3 films collectively have 16 nominations at Filmfare: Parineeti
86.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra said she's "hugely proud" that her films 'Sandeep Aur Pinky Faraar', 'The Girl on the Train' and 'Saina' collectively have earned 16 nominations at the Filmfare Awards. Parineeti has also been nominated for Best Actress for 'Sandeep Aur Pinky Faraar'. "It's...validating for me to taste success in this period where everything is in flux," she stated.

87.title: 2 suspected terrorists killed during infiltration bid in J&K's Rajouri
87.article_body: Two suspected terrorists were killed during an infiltration attempt in the Naushera sector of Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on the intervening night of Monday-Tuesday, officials said. According to officials, while a group of suspected terrorists was trying to sneak into Pukharni village, one of them stepped over a landmine, which caused an explosion.

88.title: 15-yr-old tells Pune school counsellor she was raped 7 yrs ago; FIR filed
88.article_body: A 15-year-old student told a Pune school counsellor that she was raped by a boy seven years ago when she was in Class 3. Police filed an FIR after the counsellor, along with the victim and social activists, approached a police station. The boy, suspected to be 22 years old now, lived in her neighbourhood and had called her.

89.title: Latest ODI team rankings released after India's series win
89.article_body: The ICC has released the latest men's ODI team rankings after India completed a 3-0 series whitewash against Zimbabwe. With the series victory, third-placed India's rating points have jumped to 111. Meanwhile, Pakistan, who whitewashed Netherlands recently, are on the fourth position, with four rating points fewer than India. New Zealand lead the rankings with 124 rating points.

90.title: I started hating cricket as I couldn't see my dad before he died due to cricket: Stokes
90.article_body: England Test captain Ben Stokes said he started hating cricket as he couldn't see his father before he died due to his cricketing commitments. "The last time I saw dad was leaving New Zealand to go to IPL 2020...that was dictated by cricket," he said. He added, "I should have opened up about it sooner...I just thought 'cricket, cricket, cricket'."

91.title: Without Dilip Kumar saab, I can't have a happy birthday: Saira Banu
91.article_body: Veteran actress Saira Banu, who turned 78 on Tuesday, has said her relatives and friends are getting in touch with her to wish her on her birthday. "But without Dilip Kumar saab, I can't have a happy birthday. It just cannot be the same happiness and the same life that I used to live when he was around," she added.

92.title: We pooled in money and worked for free: Deverakonda on Arjun Reddy
92.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda said his first film 'Arjun Reddy' didn't have a producer, adding they "pooled in money" and "worked for free". "We didn't even find people to release it. It took us months because we were nobody...When 'Arjun Reddy' was to release, people gathered on the streets to...stop the release," added Deverakonda. "Every film was a struggle," he stated.

93.title: Future Retail receives loan claims worth ₹21,058 crore from 33 lenders
93.article_body: Future Retail (FRL) has received loan claims worth ₹21,058 crore from 33 lenders under the ongoing insolvency process. The development comes after the National Company Law Tribunal initiated insolvency proceedings against the debt-ridden company. Of the total claims made by creditors, about ₹17,511 crore has been verified by the interim resolution professional, the Kishore Biyani-led company said.

94.title: Debt-ridden man poisons wife, 2 kids; kills self at hotel in T'gana
94.article_body: A 37-year-old man poisoned his wife and two children and later died by suicide at a hotel in Telangana's Nizamabad district on Sunday, police said. According to officials, Suryaprakash had a real estate business in Madhapur and Kondapur, and was encountering losses. He had borrowed money from his business partners who had been pressuring him to repay it, police added.

95.title: Took 2 yrs to sign Tyson, talks broke down at one stage: Liger producer
95.article_body: 'Liger' producer Charmme Kaur said it took them two years to sign boxing legend Mike Tyson, adding that talks broke down at one point. "We sealed the deal...and then, COVID-19 happened...Tyson's team told me it's a deal-breaker...It was heartbreaking," added Charmme. Charmme stated that Tyson eventually agreed. "He would jump around in childlike glee, saying, 'I'm an actor!'" she said.

96.title: I request Rohit Sharma to make a statement, name the XI for Asia Cup: Kaif
96.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has requested Team India captain Rohit Sharma to name the playing XI for the upcoming Asia Cup. "This is not about playing mind games...Rohit should make a statement, that this is our playing XI...Let's win this Asia Cup," stated Kaif. "Last year, Pakistan announced their XI a day earlier, but we waited for toss," he added.

97.title: BJP foisting 'false' cases against Oppn leaders ahead of 2024 LS polls: Akhilesh
97.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday said that the BJP is foisting "false" cases against Opposition leaders in the run-up to the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "BJP foisting false cases…to divert people's attention from real issues such as price rise and unemployment," he added. "Action is being taken against them through government agencies…they are being sent to jail," Akhilesh stated.

98.title: E-comm firms speed up hiring of delivery agents for shopping season
98.article_body: E-commerce companies in India are accelerating the hiring of delivery personnel ahead of the annual shopping season that commences next month. Delivery workers and salespersons form a large chunk of the gig work employment. It is expected to reach 9.9 million in India in 2022-23, a rise of about 45% from 2019-20, according to a NITI Aayog report in June.

99.title: Police pose as food delivery men to catch bike-borne snatchers in Mumbai
99.article_body: A team of policemen posed as food delivery executives and camped outside Mumbai's Vithalwadi railway station for three days to catch two chain snatchers. The investigation began after a businessman complained that his gold chain was snatched by two bike-borne men near Borivali National Park. Police scanned over 200 CCTV cameras to arrest the duo accused in four such cases.

100.title: Arrest warrant against dancer Sapna Choudhary for not performing at an event
100.article_body: An arrest warrant has been issued against Haryanvi dancer and singer Sapna Choudhary. Sapna had not performed at an event in 2018 for which she was paid by organisers in advance, following which the organisers filed a court case, according to ANI. She will reportedly be produced in a court in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow soon.

101.title: Domestic help sentenced to 30 yrs for sexually assaulting employers' son in C'garh
101.article_body: A 25-year-old man employed as domestic help by a doctor couple in Chandigarh has been sentenced to 30 years of rigorous imprisonment for sexually assaulting their 8-year-old son. The incident came to light when the victim's mother came home early and caught him in the act. The Chandigarh district court also imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on the convict.

102.title: Car barges into Jammu railway station; minor girl dead, 6 injured
102.article_body: A speeding car barged into Jammu railway station's premises and fatally hit a seven-year-old girl and left six others injured on Monday, officials said. According to eyewitnesses, the car entered from the wrong side, hit multiple people, rammed into an autorickshaw and then stopped. The wife of an injured person claimed that the administration and police aren't helping her.

103.title: Trump seeks to block FBI from reviewing items seized from Florida home
103.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump has asked a federal court to stop the FBI from reviewing the documents it seized from his Florida home earlier this month until a special master can be appointed to oversee the process. In a lawsuit, Trump has also demanded a receipt of all the items the FBI seized at Mar-a-Lago on August 8.

104.title: Chandigarh sets 25 kmph speed limit around schools, hospitals
104.article_body: Chandigarh administration has fixed a maximum speed limit of 25 kmph for all vehicles around schools, educational institutions and hospitals. "We've shared the cautionary signages to be installed around schools," SSP (Traffic and Security) Manisha Choudhary said. "We had recommended the speed limit...as per the Motor Vehicle Act in the last Road Safety Council meeting on July 27," Choudhary added.

105.title: BJP T'gana chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar detained amid protest against arrest of party workers
105.article_body: Telangana Police has detained BJP state chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar in Jangaon. "Kumar was holding a protest against party workers' arrest in Hyderabad," BJP's NV Subhash said. "Strongly condemn police registering a case of attempted murder against BJP leaders who were protesting at CM KCR's daughter K Kavitha's house demanding an answer to allegations in Delhi's liquor scam," Kumar tweeted.

106.title: Noida Supertech twin towers fitted with 3,700-kg explosives, to take 10 seconds to blast
106.article_body: The illegal Supertech twin towers in Noida have been rigged with around 3,700 kg of explosives ahead of its demolition on Sunday, officials said. "It'll take 9-10 seconds for all the explosives to blast in a series making a loud noise. After the blasts, the structures...would take four to five seconds to come down completely," an Edifice Engineering partner said.

107.title: Why did you select Rahul Tripathi at all: Aakash Chopra on Zimbabwe ODIs
107.article_body: Commentator Aakash Chopra has asked why Rahul Tripathi was selected in the squad for the Zimbabwe ODIs when he was not going to be given a chance to play in the series. "You're not even able to play him in a dead rubber," added Aakash. India played the third and final ODI with an unassailable 2-0 lead.

108.title: Usain Bolt files for trademark to protect his famous victory pose in US
108.article_body: Athletics icon Usain Bolt has filed an application with the US Patent and Trademark Office to trademark a logo of his signature victory celebration pose. The widely recognised pose features Bolt leaning back and gesturing to the sky. According to the trademark application, Bolt plans to use the logo on items including clothing, jewellery, restaurants and sports bars.

109.title: Bilkis Bano case convicts' release challenged in SC, CJI to consider listing it
109.article_body: The release of 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case has been challenged in the Supreme Court. Reports said that Chief Justice NV Ramana has said he would consider listing the matter.  Bilkis Bano had issued a statement after their release, saying that the release has taken her peace and shaken her faith in justice.

110.title: Elon Musk criticised over claims he took a 9-minute trip on his private jet
110.article_body: Elon Musk is being criticised after a Twitter user claimed that the world's richest person took a 9-minute flight from San Jose to San Francisco on his private jet. The user wrote that the same distance on an express train would have been five stops or nearly an hour. Meanwhile, a journalist suggested that the jet was likely being repositioned.

111.title: Class 4 girl collapses near stairs at pvt school in Gurugram, dies
111.article_body: A class four student died after she allegedly fell unconscious at a private school in Gurugram on Monday, police said. A police officer said that the family of the girl, who had felt dizzy and collapsed near the stairs, "hasn't filed any complaint or alleged foul play". The girl's grandfather said that the deceased "didn't suffer from any health ailment."

112.title: Man pushes wife in front of moving train, runs away with 2 children in Maha; video surfaces
112.article_body: A man killed his wife by pushing her in front of a moving train at Vasai Road railway station in Maharashtra on Monday. The CCTV footage showed the man waking his wife up, dragging her to the edge of the platform and pushing her in front of the train. The man later picked up his two children and ran away.

113.title: Would be dream come true if I get cast in mythological film: Sharvari
113.article_body: Actress Sharvari Wagh has said that it would be "an absolute dream come true" for her if she gets cast in a mythological film. "My father used to narrate the Mahabharata to me every night when I was a child and I used to be fascinated with the tale," she added. She revealed she "voraciously" read mythologies growing up.

114.title: Gehlot can't see anything beyond devotion to Gandhi family: Shekhawat
114.article_body: Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot can't see anything beyond devotion to Gandhi family. His remarks came after Gehlot criticised BJP for forgetting leaders like ex-PM Jawaharlal Nehru and Indira Gandhi. "Gehlot...didn't understand the definition of 'Amrit Mahotsav' of Independence under which...BJP honoured those who were unknown in the country," Shekhawat said.

115.title: US Labor Dept accuses Hyundai supplier of violating child labour laws
115.article_body: SL Alabama, the Korean-owned auto parts maker and supplier of Hyundai Motor, was accused by the US Department of Labor of violating child labour laws by employing underage workers at an Alabama factory. Admitting to the allegation, SL said an external labour recruitment firm had hired the minors. Hyundai said, "It doesn't tolerate illegal employment practices in any Hyundai entity."

116.title: Australian boy with dwarfism, who was bullied, lands role in 'Mad Max' movie
116.article_body: Quaden Bayles, an indigenous Australian boy who won the support of celebrities after being bullied because of his disability, has landed a role in forthcoming movie 'Mad Max: Furiosa'. Oscar-winning director George Miller said he was moved to put the 11-year-old on the big screen after watching the video his mother shared of him in 2020.

117.title: They didn't talk about the film's story even once: Vivek on 'Laal...'
117.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri said there's nobody who can tell what 'Laal Singh Chaddha' is about, if they haven't seen the film, as the story wasn't discussed by the makers. Talking about 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' and 'Shamshera', Vivek stated, "'Jayeshbhai'...was about female infanticide. But...Ranveer...danced with girls...[during promotions]...Same thing happened with...Shamshera."

118.title: Over a dozen aspiring teachers injured in police lathicharge in Patna
118.article_body: Over a dozen job aspirants protesting over pending appointments of teachers were injured in a lathicharge by police in Patna on Monday. Some of the protesters allegedly pelted stones at police, who then used water cannons and resorted to lathicharge. Patna ADM KK Singh was seen beating a protester, following which DM Chandrashekhar Singh ordered a probe against him.

119.title: Swapna Patkar, a witness in the Patra Chawl scam, summoned by ED
119.article_body: Swapna Patkar, a key witness in the Patra Chawl scam case, has been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate for questioning today. Patkar, who lodged several complaints since 2013 against unknown people for stalking and harassment, had alleged that MP Sanjay Raut was behind it. The judicial custody of Raut has been extended till September 5 in connection with the case.

120.title: Rahul should accept Cong President’s post, understand workers’ sentiments: Raj CM
120.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday said that if Rahul Gandhi does not become Congress President, it will be a disappointment for Congress workers across the country. "He should understand the sentiments of Congress workers and accept this post," Gehlot added. He stated that the party is "unanimously" in favour of Rahul Gandhi becoming the next Congress President.

121.title: 16-yr-old strangles 13-yr-old Dalit in Ghaziabad to 'get out of studying'
121.article_body: A 16-year-old boy has been arrested in Ghaziabad for strangling a 13-year-old Dalit boy to death on Monday. The accused revealed during interrogation that he had decided to commit a crime as a way to "get out of studying", police said. The boys were neighbours and had gone out to play. The victim's body was discovered on the Delhi-Meerut expressway.

122.title: Apple to start making iPhone 14 in India 2 months after China production: Report
122.article_body: Apple will start manufacturing iPhone 14 in India two months after the Chinese-made ones are released, Bloomberg reported. Apple is reportedly aiming to shorten the gap in the production of new iPhone in India from six to nine months for previous launches. The first iPhone 14s from India are likely to be finished by October or November, the report added.

123.title: Twitter users react as Man Utd beat Liverpool in PL for 1st time since 2018
123.article_body: Manchester United defeated Liverpool 2-1 in a Premier League match to record their first win against the latter since 2018. "United showing 17 other clubs exactly how to play against Liverpool," read a tweet from a fan. "Imagine the embarrassment of being a Liverpool fan and your season's so bad, you can't even beat Man United!" read another reaction.

124.title: The way Raza was batting, we felt he could snatch the game away: Axar Patel
124.article_body: Team India all-rounder Axar Patel has said the way Zimbabwe all-rounder Sikandar Raza batted while chasing India's 290-run target in the third ODI, they felt he could "snatch the game away". "But we backed our plans and did not relax till the last ball," added Axar. Raza got out after scoring 115 and Zimbabwe lost the game by 13 runs.

125.title: SP leader arrested in UP for rally against release of Bilkis' rapists
125.article_body: SP leader Shane Alam was arrested on Monday in UP's Moradabad for holding a rally against the release of convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case. He raised slogans against Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the country, said police. He and three others have been booked for rioting and promoting enmity between groups.

126.title: 7 injured as fire breaks out at pharma unit on Hyderabad outskirts
126.article_body: Seven workers of a pharmaceutical factory were injured when a major fire broke out on the firm premises at Jeedimetla Industrial Estate on the outskirts of Hyderabad on Monday. Locals reported hearing a loud explosion following which fire and smoke engulfed the facility. "All...injured workers are being treated at...local hospitals at Shapur Nagar," Jeedimetla Police Inspector M Sridhar said.

127.title: Video shows delivery boy carrying daughter & son to deliver food; Zomato responds
127.article_body: Food blogger Saurabh Panjwani shared a video showing a Zomato delivery agent carrying his small daughter and son while delivering food. "This Zomato delivery partner spends the whole day in the sun with two children," he wrote. "Please share the order details in a private message so that we can reach out and help out the delivery partner," Zomato commented.

128.title: Want to change UK-India relationship, make it more two-way: Sunak
128.article_body: UK PM candidate Rishi Sunak said he wants to change the UK-India relationship to make it a more "two-way relationship" that opens up easy access to British students and companies in India. Sunak made these comments during a campaign event hosted by Conservative Friends of India diaspora organisation in London. The new UK PM will be announced on September 5.

129.title: Man shot dead by 2 bike-borne persons while on way to work in Pune
129.article_body: A 27-year-old man was shot dead by two bike-borne persons near a temple in Pune's Chandan Nagar area while he was on his way to work. "Efforts are on to nab...accused and teams are checking CCTV footage of the area for clues," police officials said. The police suspect that the incident took place over a fall-out of past rivalry.

130.title: 4 of family, on way to celebrate 2-yr-old's b'day, killed in accident in Raj
130.article_body: Four family members, including two children aged two and eight years, were killed in a road accident in Rajasthan's Sikar district on Monday. The incident occurred when their car collided with a truck coming from opposite direction, police said. Notably, the family was on its way to celebrate the birthday of the two-year-old girl who also died in the incident.

131.title: If you don't like me, don't watch me: Alia Bhatt on nepotism criticism
131.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, speaking about dealing with nepotism debate and trolls, has said, "I can't keep defending myself verbally...if you don't like me, don't watch me. I can't help it." She added that she could end the conversation through her movies. "I shut up, went home and did my work. I delivered a film like 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'," she stated.

132.title: Brain-chip startup Neuralink to give progress update on Oct 31: Musk
132.article_body: Elon Musk has announced that his brain-chip startup Neuralink will provide a progress update in a 'show and tell' event on Halloween, October 31. In its last big update, Neuralink had demonstrated a monkey with a chip implanted in its brain playing a video game. The announcement comes amid reports that Neuralink has offered to invest in its rival Synchron.

133.title: Revenue Secy Tarun Bajaj gets additional charge of Corporate Affairs Secretary
133.article_body: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj has been given additional charge of Secretary in the Ministry of Corporate Affairs. This comes after former Secretary Rajesh Verma was made Secretary to President Droupadi Murmu last week. The Ministry of Personnel, Public Grievances and Pensions said that Bajaj will continue with the additional charge till a regular Secretary is appointed or until further orders.

134.title: TikTok star and BJP leader Sonali Phogat dies of heart attack in Goa
134.article_body: TikTok star and BJP leader Sonali Phogat died last night of a heart attack in Goa. Phogat had lost from the Adampur seat in the 2019 Haryana Assembly elections to Congress leader Kuldeep Bishnoi, who recently switched over from the Congress party to the BJP. Phogat had said she won't quit TikTok or acting if she becomes an MLA.

135.title: Worked on Vijay's body for 2+ yrs, used to workout at his home: Coach on Liger
135.article_body: Fitness coach Kuldep Sethi said he worked with actor Vijay Deverakonda for 'Liger' for over two years due to COVID-19 lockdown. "Otherwise...it would have taken...around six months to achieve and maintain his physique," he said. "We had to keep working out through lockdown...[or] he would have...lost the look we had achieved. We used to workout at his home," he added.

136.title: Argentine prosecutor seeks 12-year jail term for Vice President
136.article_body: An Argentine federal prosecutor has asked a judge to sentence Cristina Fernández, Argentina's ex-President and current Vice President, to 12 years in prison and bar her from holding public office ever again. Fernández has been on trial since 2019 for allegedly defrauding the state and involvement in a scheme to divert public funds while being President between 2007 and 2015.

137.title: Who is Anna Mani, the Weather Woman of India, celebrated by Google today?
137.article_body: Google is celebrating physicist and meteorologist Anna Mani's 104th birth anniversary with a special doodle. Anna Mani, known as 'the Weather Woman of India', was born in 1918 in Kerala and was one of India's first female scientists, who later served as the Deputy Director General of the IMD. She played a major role in the field of meteorological instrumentation.

138.title: Missing J&K woman found dead in Punjab; protesters block highway
138.article_body: After a woman from Jammu and Kashmir's Samba was found dead near railway tracks in Punjab's Ludhiana, hundreds of protesters on Monday blocked Jammu-Pathankot National Highway by placing her body on the road and demanded a CBI probe. The deceased's father alleged that there was "foul play" involved. The protesters dispersed peacefully after police and civil administration officials pacified them.

139.title: T'gana BJP MLA Raja Singh arrested over remarks against Prophet after massive protests
139.article_body: Telangana BJP MLA T Raja Singh has been arrested over alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad following massive protests in Hyderabad. This comes after Singh released a 'comedy' video against comedian Munawar Faruqui who held a show in Hyderabad last week. Protesters blocked the road outside the city police commissioner's office and entered the office of DCP (south zone).

140.title: Finnish PM Sanna Marin tests negative in drug test taken after her viral party video
140.article_body: Finnish PM Sanna Marin has tested negative in a drug test that she took after a video showing her partying went viral on social media. Marin previously said she was "spending an evening with friends" and that the video was "filmed in private premises". "Never in my life...have I ever used any drugs," she had said.

141.title: Bollywood is discredited by people who don't like us: Swara Bhasker
141.article_body: Speaking about cancel culture, actress Swara Bhasker stated that Bollywood is discredited by people who don't like certain individuals. The actress added that films like Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha', Taapsee Pannu's 'Dobaaraa' and Akshay Kumar's 'Raksha Bandhan' have suffered due to boycott trends on Twitter. She further said Bollywood is not responsible for audience not coming to theatres.

142.title: Man makes friend's Facebook ID, threatens to blow up Gorakhnath temple; held
142.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police have arrested a man for threatening to blow up Gorakhnath temple. He had shared a post after making Facebook ID in his friend's name. "Mubarak Ali [accused] had borrowed ₹40,000 from Basalat Ali...When Basalat Ali asked him to return money...Mubarak Ali took a SIM in [his] name...[and] posted threat message to implicate him in...police case," police said.

143.title: Dravid tests positive for COVID-19, unlikely to travel with team for Asia Cup: Reports
143.article_body: Team India head coach Rahul Dravid has tested positive for COVID-19 just days ahead of the Asia Cup 2022, as per reports. He is unlikely to travel with the team to UAE for the tournament that will start on August 27, reports added. India will open their Asia Cup 2022 campaign against Pakistan on August 28.

144.title: Goods train derails near Bhubaneswar station; rly traffic affected
144.article_body: Five wagons of a goods train derailed near Odisha's Bhubaneswar Railway Station on Monday due to which railway traffic was affected on Bhubaneswar-Kolkata route, DRM Khurda Road Rinkesh Roy said. The incident occurred around 8.30 pm. Many trains were affected and passengers were sleeping at the station as they were unable to return to their houses or hotels, he added.

145.title: Everyone kept calling Rahul 'pappu' so now all believe it, but he's intelligent: Swara
145.article_body: Speaking about Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, actress Swara Bhasker said, "Everyone kept calling him pappu, so now everybody believes it. I have met him and he is a perfectly intelligent and articulate man." She said this while comparing Rahul's situation with the hate against Bollywood and added, "With Bollywood also, this 'pappufication' has happened."

146.title: I hope so too: Rashmika to fan saying her Pushpa 2 role should be more impactful
146.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna responded to a fan on social media who requested for her character Srivalli to be stronger and more impactful in 'Pushpa: The Rule'. The actress tweeted, "I hope so too let's see." Rashmika portrays the love interest of Allu Arjun's character in the first film 'Pushpa: The Rise'. The sequel went on floors on Monday.

147.title: Nizam sitting at Centre scared of Arvind Kejriwal: Manish Sisodia
147.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday said that the "Nizam sitting in the Centre is scared of CM Arvind Kejriwal". "So, in order to arrest his Education Minister, you raid his residence and search his cupboards, ration, mattresses, pillows and blankets to see if there is any hidden gold or money," Sisodia added. "I am honest," he stated.

148.title: Crude oil price rises after Saudi warns OPEC+ could cut production
148.article_body: Crude oil prices rose on Tuesday after Saudi Arabia warned that OPEC+ could cut production to stabilise the market after a drop in oil futures. West Texas Intermediate for October delivery rose 0.4% to $90.72/barrel on the New York Mercantile Exchange at 8:05 am in Singapore. Brent for October settlement rose 0.3% to $96.81/barrel on the ICE Futures Europe exchange.

149.title: My unconventional choices have stood out, become my brand identity: Bhumi
149.article_body: Actress Bhumi Pednekar has said that her unconventional choices in projects have stood out and have become her brand identity. "Today, I'm assuming that people naturally feel...if I'm a part of a project, it will be different, disruptive and high on content," she added. Bhumi further added, "They know...I'll do my best to deliver a performance that they will love."

150.title: Raza gave a good fight, but India held their nerves: Zimbabwe captain on 13-run defeat
150.article_body: Zimbabwe captain Regis Chakabva has praised all-rounder Sikandar Raza for his 115-run innings against India in the third and final ODI. "Raza...gave a good fight, but India held their nerve...The boys fought hard in the field [also]. We came back strongly from a tough situation. Raza was outstanding," stated Chakabva. Chasing India's 290-run target, Zimbabwe got bundled out for 276.

151.title: Centre suspends ex-excise commissioner, deputy in Delhi liquor 'scam'
151.article_body: Ministry of Home Affairs suspended former Delhi excise commissioner Arava Gopi Krishna and former deputy excise commissioner Anand Kumar Tiwari in connection with the alleged Delhi liquor scam, officials said. Krishna and Tiwari were named by CBI in FIR in the ongoing probe. Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia is also named in FIR in connection with the alleged scam.

152.title: Have seen people lose their lives after their films leaked: Arun Vijay
152.article_body: Actor Arun Vijay, who featured in the show 'Tamil Rockerz' which is based on film piracy, has said, "It's high time people realise and stop watching pirated content." He further added, "Everyone gets affected, not just financially. We have seen people losing their lives." Arun said that people will see the efforts of the film industry after watching 'Tamil Rockerz'.

153.title: I'm detached from comparisons, else I'll lose focus: Vaani Kapoor
153.article_body: Actress Vaani Kapoor stated that she is detached from being compared to or pitted against other actors, adding that it's okay since they are public figures. "If I keep fretting over what others are doing, I will lose my focus and my dedication," she said. The actress added that one needs to be a horse with blinders in the industry.

154.title: I still feel very young, got my dad's genes: Sonam on being mother at 37
154.article_body: Speaking about becoming a mother at the age of 37, actress Sonam Kapoor stated that she still feels "very young", adding that she has her father Anil Kapoor's genes. The actress said, "Everyone's so tense about women who get pregnant after 31 or 32. They tell you...don't get gestational diabetes or pre-eclampsia. I was like...'It'll be fine'."

155.title: Each joint like a speed breaker: B'luru police ex-chief on Shivananda flyover
155.article_body: Bengaluru's former Police Commissioner and current AAP leader Bhaskar Rao criticised the quality of construction of the Shivananda Circle steel flyover. "I travelled on Shivananda Circle flyover, each joint seemed like a speed breaker," Rao tweeted. "We can grin and bear it as none will be held accountable," he added. The newly-opened flyover has been closed citing repair work.

156.title: Corrupt water meter readers & firms to face FIRs in Delhi: Saurabh Bharadwaj
156.article_body: Delhi Jal Board vice-chairman Saurabh Bharadwaj on Monday asked officials to file police complaints against water meter readers and private companies indulging in corrupt practices. “Water is a basic right of everyone irrespective of one’s status in life...There are reports where private meter readers have been demanding money to manipulate meter readings,” said Bharadwaj.

157.title: Targeting of judges in public domain must be contained: Vice Prez Dhankhar
157.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Monday said that targeting judges in the public domain needs to be contained. "Recent unfortunate emergence of a pernicious trend to target individual judges in the public domain calls for exemplary containment," Dhankhar added. "Dignity of judges is key and among the fundamental parts of the rule of law and constitutionalism," he stated.

158.title: Mumbai's 150-yr-old Carnac Bridge shut, to open again after reconstruction
158.article_body: Mumbai's Carnac Bridge, which is reportedly over 150 years old was shut down for vehicular and pedestrian traffic on August 22. It will re-open after reconstruction. Traffic from P D'Mello Road towards Chakala Junction will be diverted to Avtar Singh Bedi Chowk. Vehicles can also move through Wadi Bunder Junction and proceed to Chakala Junction via SVP Road, reports said.

159.title: India reports 8,586 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, positivity rate drops to 2.19%
159.article_body: India has reported 8,586 new COVID-19 cases and 48 deaths in the last 24 hours including six reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Health Ministry. Active cases in the country went down to 96,506, while the daily positivity rate declined to 2.19%. India also reported 9,680 recoveries in the last 24 hours, taking the total recoveries to 4,37,33,624.

160.title: World number one Carlsen praises 17-year-old Praggnanandhaa, jokes about his own age
160.article_body: World number one chess player Magnus Carlsen praised 17-year-old Indian Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa for his performance at FTX Crypto Cup. "Fully deserved...after performance that showed great resilience, determination, and quality," he wrote for Praggnanandhaa, who came second. "As for me, I'm happy to (barely) be younger than the second & third place finishers combined," the 31-year-old wrote.

161.title: Nandan Nilekani-backed startup ShopX shuts down, files for bankruptcy
161.article_body: E-commerce platform ShopX, backed by Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani, has confirmed that it has shut down operations. The startup has filed an application under Section 10 of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016. ShopX decided to shut down business after "it became unviable to operate at scale given the low margin profile", a spokesperson for the company told Financial Express.

162.title: Will respect Brazil election result if clean, transparent: Bolsonaro
162.article_body: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said he'd respect the result of an October election if the voting is "clean and transparent". Bolsonaro, in an interview with TV Globo's Jornal Nacional, also insisted, without evidence, that there had been fraud in past Brazilian elections. Opinion polls show Bolsonaro trailing in the Presidential race to leftist rival, ex-President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva.

163.title: We should learn to spell his name correctly: Mahindra as Praggnanandhaa defeats Carlsen
163.article_body: After India's 17-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen at FTX Crypto Cup, businessman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "We should all learn how to spell his name correctly!" "Take a good look at that young, but intense face. If Chess is a Game of Thrones then there may be a new occupier of the throne soon," Mahindra added.

164.title: Masked assailants open fire in Delhi's JJ Colony; 2 killed, 1 injured
164.article_body: At least two persons were killed and one was seriously injured after masked assailants opened fire in Delhi's JJ Colony area. "The neighbours informed me...two people came...fired at my brother and two other older men who were sitting with him," the brother of one of the deceased said. "Police told us two people were killed, including my brother," he added.

165.title: Brazil's 1st emperor's heart arrives from Portugal to mark 200 yrs of independence
165.article_body: The embalmed heart of Brazil's first emperor, Dom Pedro I, has arrived in the capital Brasilia to mark 200 years of independence from Portugal. The heart, which has been kept in an urn with formaldehyde since Pedro's death in 1834, was flown on board a military plane from Portugal. The heart will be returned to Portugal after Brazil's independence day.

166.title: Which 5 teams are yet to win a match in PL 2022-23 as Gameweek 3 concludes?
166.article_body: Liverpool, who lost to Manchester United on Monday night, have failed to win any of their opening three games of the season and are placed 16th on the Premier League table. Liverpool are followed by Everton with two defeats and one draw. Wolves, Leicester City and West Ham are also yet to register a victory in the season so far.

167.title: Sensex falls 361 points to open at 58,412, Nifty down 114 points
167.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the red on Tuesday with Sensex falling 361.86 points to 58,412.01. Nifty was down 114.70 points at 17,376. Wipro, Infosys, Tech Mahindra, HCL Technologies and Tata Motors were among the major Nifty losers, while NTPC, Power Grid Corp and Mahindra & Mahindra stocks gained. Nearly 727 shares advanced and 1,176 shares declined.

168.title: Next Nobel Prize for himself: BJP leader after Kejriwal's 'Bharat Ratna' remark
168.article_body: Soon after Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said his deputy Manish Sisodia deserves "Bharat Ratna", BJP’s BL Santhosh tweeted, "Padma Vibhushan for Satyendar Jain…Bharat Ratna for Manish Sisodia…Next Nobel Prize for himself…Great going anarchist party AAP." Santhosh tweeted without mentioning Kejriwal's name. "Such a person should get Bharat Ratna...they conducted CBI raid against him," Kejriwal had said.

169.title: B'luru's Shivananda bridge closed after commuters complain of uneven surface
169.article_body: Bengaluru's Shivananda Circle flyover, which was opened to the public last week, has been closed by the civic authorities. Reportedly, this comes after passengers complained about the uneven and steep gradient of the bridge and called the travel experience "back-breaking". The bridge is expected to reduce travel time to reach the Seshadripuram railway underpass from the Race Course Road.

170.title: Family to get ₹1 crore if defence personnel dies in service: Gujarat government
170.article_body: The Gujarat government has announced ₹1 crore compensation for the families of defence or paramilitary personnel who die "under any circumstances" while in service. The monthly assistance of ₹1,000 for widows of slain defence/ paramilitary personnel has also been revised to ₹5,000. Parents of unmarried soldiers are now entitled to ₹5 lakh compensation and ₹5,000 each per month for both.

171.title: Actor Arjun Bijlani replaces Rannvijay Singha as Splitsvilla 14 host
171.article_body: Actor Arjun Bijlani will be replacing Rannvijay Singha as the host of 'Splitsvilla X4' and will be hosting the show with actress Sunny Leone. "The show has always been such a massive hit with the youth...I'm super excited to take up this mantle," Arjun said in a statement. "I'm looking forward to Arjun as my co-host," Sunny stated.

172.title: Nitish not even 'CM material', how could he be 'PM material'?: Union Minister
172.article_body: Union Minister Giriraj Singh said Bihar CM Nitish Kumar is not even "CM material" as he couldn't form a government on his own even once. "We formed an alliance with him and made him CM. But like 2010, he was once again bitten by PM material bug…He's not even CM material, how can he become PM material?" Singh asked.

173.title: Tree falls in college premises in Pune; gardener killed, 3 injured
173.article_body: A 49-year-old gardener was killed and three others were injured after a 30-foot-tall tree fell on the premises of Pune's SP College on Monday, fire brigade officials said. The college had sent letters to PMC about the old tree that could fall anytime, a contractual worker of the college stated. An accidental death case has been filed, a sub-inspector said.

174.title: Wall Street closes lower amid fears over Fed's stance at Wyoming
