174.article_body: Wall Street closed lower on Monday as investors worried about the US Federal Reserve's stance on interest rates at the Wyoming gathering later this week. The S&P 500 dropped by 2.1% and the Dow Jones Industrial Average fell by 1.9%. The Nasdaq declined by 2.5%. Among the losers were Nvidia Corporation, which dropped by 4.6%, and Amazon.com falling 3.6%.

175.title: Day after sharp dip, COVID-19 cases cross 900-mark in Bengaluru
175.article_body: A day after Bengaluru recorded a sharp dip in COVID-19 cases with just 273 new patients, the number climbed back to cross the 900-mark on Monday. The city saw 931 new cases in a day, taking the cumulative total to 18,58,948, BBMP Chief Commissioner tweeted. No new deaths were recorded, while the positivity rate stood at 6.12%.

176.title: Hyd police book BJP MLA Raja Singh for remarks on Prophet Muhammad
176.article_body: The Hyderabad police on Tuesday morning registered an FIR against Goshamahal BJP legislator T Raja Singh for his alleged remarks against Prophet Muhammad. Singh had reportedly released a video late last night wherein he made derogatory comments about Prophet Muhammad and called it "comedy". Multiple complaints were filed against him at various police stations in Hyderabad's south zone.

177.title: Delhi hospital staffer demands ₹25,000 bribe to get man admitted, held
177.article_body: Delhi's Anti-Corruption Branch (ACB) has arrested a 48-year-old nursing orderly of GB Pant Hospital for allegedly demanding a ₹25,000 bribe to get an injured man admitted to another hospital, officials said. The complainant, who was the injured man's employer, had initially paid ₹10,000 to the accused but later approached ACB when accused apparently threatened him to pay the remaining amount.

178.title: Vile, cruel crime: Russian Prez Putin on murder of ally's daughter
178.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday called the killing of Darya Dugina, daughter of his close ally Alexander Dugin, in a car bomb attack near Moscow on Saturday "a vile, cruel crime". He also posthumously awarded Dugina the Order of Courage, praising her "dedication shown in the performance of professional duty". Russia has accused Ukrainian special services of killing Dugina.

179.title: Is his ideology that of terrorists?: Vivek after Kashyap's remark on 'The...'
179.article_body: Reacting to filmmaker Anurag Kashyap saying he hasn't seen 'The Kashmir Files' as it's "not his ideology", the film's director Vivek Agnihotri tweeted, "Does this mean his ideology is that of Islamic Terrorists Brotherhood?" "This genius filmmaker says the film which is about Hindu genocide isn't his ideology," added Vivek. "Look at the intellectual dishonesty of these people," he stated.

180.title: Imams from other states will have to inform police, register on govt portal: Assam CM
180.article_body: All imams (clerics) from outside Assam will have to report to the local police station for verification of identity, CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said. An online government portal will be made on which imams and madrasa teachers will have to register themselves, Sarma added. This comes after two Assam imams were arrested over alleged links with Al-Qaeda-affiliated terror outfits.

181.title: Sania pulls out of US Open due to injury, says 'It'll change some of my retirement plans'
181.article_body: Indian tennis player Sania Mirza has pulled out of US Open 2022 due to injury. Taking to Instagram, she wrote, "I'll be out for a [few] weeks...This isn't ideal and it's terrible timing and it will change some of my retirement plans." Earlier this year, Sania had said that she wouldn't be playing beyond the 2022 season.

182.title: Businessman forces wife to bathe naked in public in 'ritual to conceive boy' in Maha
182.article_body: A 38-year-old businessman allegedly forced his wife to bathe naked in public under a waterfall in Maharashtra's Ratnagiri as part of a black magic ritual initiated by a self-styled godman. He allegedly told the couple it'd help them conceive a male child. Police arrested four people including the man, his father, mother and the self-styled godman after the woman's complaint.

183.title: Fan asks Afridi his views on Kohli not scoring a century in 1,000+ days, he replies
183.article_body: During a question-answer session on Twitter, a fan asked former Pakistan captain and all-rounder Shahid Afridi about his take on Virat Kohli not scoring an international century for over 1,000 days. Afridi replied, "Bare players ka mushkil waqt me hi pata chalta hai (the true spirit of big players is seen when they are facing difficult times.)"

184.title: Team India players dance on 'Kala Chashma' in dressing room to celebrate win, video viral
184.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Team India players, including Shikhar Dhawan, Shubman Gill and Ishan Kishan, dancing on 'Kala Chashma' in the dressing room after their ODI series victory against Zimbabwe in Harare. The video was shared by Dhawan and Gill on their Instagram handles. Commenting on the video, Yuvraj Singh jokingly wrote, "Stick to cricket lads."

185.title: Elon Musk subpoenas Twitter ex-CEO Jack Dorsey in $44 bn takeover lawsuit
185.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk has subpoenaed his friend and former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey as he attempts to back out of the $44 billion acquisition deal. Dorsey is being asked for documents relating to the merger as well as information on spam accounts on Twitter. Twitter and Musk are headed for a trial over the merger in October.

186.title: Law considers women as 'weaker section' of society requiring more protection: HC
186.article_body: The Bombay High Court last week transferred a matrimonial case observing that a "lady's inconvenience needs to be given more priority because the law considers women as class belonging to weaker section of society and needs more protection". The court granted relief to a woman who had sought transfer of her matrimonial dispute from Pune to Thane.

187.title: Subsidies on EVs won't be very healthy beyond a point: Delhi Minister
187.article_body: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot said it would not be "very healthy" to provide subsidies to buyers of electric vehicles beyond a point. "Subsidies are good to create demand...EVs have to be within the reach of the common person eventually," he added. Delhi government has set a target of one charging point in a radius of three kilometres, Gahlot stated.

188.title: 30-yr-old Mumbai man posts 'derogatory' content on Prophet on WhatsApp; held
188.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested in Mumbai's Malad for allegedly using derogatory content on Prophet Mohammed on his WhatsApp status. An FIR was registered on charges under Information Technology Act sections 295A and 67A. Reports said the accused, who is a real estate agent, was produced before a magistrate's court and has been remanded in police custody for two days.

189.title: Dad Anil doesn't see himself as grandparent, he's scared: Sonam Kapoor
189.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor, who recently welcomed her first child, said that her father and actor Anil Kapoor does not see himself as a grandparent. "I think my dad is scared...for a long time, he didn't even see himself as a parent," she added. However, Sonam revealed that it was Anil who got emotional after she told him she was expecting.

190.title: Ford to lay off 3,000 employees in India, US & Canada to slash costs
190.article_body: Ford Motor has confirmed that it is cutting 3,000 salaried and contract jobs in India, US and Canada as the carmaker looks to slash costs. In a memo to staff, CEO Jim Farley said the company is "eliminating work, as well as reorganising and simplifying functions". He also acknowledged that Ford's cost structure "is uncompetitive versus traditional and new competitors".

191.title: Manchester United defeat Liverpool 2-1 to record their 1st win of season
191.article_body: Manchester United defeated Liverpool 2-1 in Premier League 2022-23 at Old Trafford to register their first victory of the season, after having lost to Brighton and Brentford. Jadon Sancho opened the scoring for United in the 16th minute. Marcus Rashford made it 2-0 in the 53rd minute. Mohamed Salah scored the lone goal for Liverpool in the 81st minute.

192.title: Inter-state drug peddlers arrested in Hyd, 590 kg of ganja seized
192.article_body: A Special Operation Team of the LB Nagar Zone, along with Abdullapurmet Police, arrested six people and seized 590 kg of ganja. According to the release, the prime accused got involved in the illegal transportation of ganja in 2019. The police arrested the six accused, along with eight mobile phones, cash worth ₹1,900, a car and a pickup vehicle.

193.title: Man sexually assaults 30-yr-old woman, holds her captive in Delhi
193.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly sexually abusing a 30-year-old woman and holding her captive in Delhi, police said on Monday. The accused established a physical relationship with the victim in UP's Shahjahanpur on the pretext of marriage, said ASP (city) Sanjay Kumar, adding that the accused took her to Delhi, where she was raped and kept locked up.

194.title: Mohammad Hasnain named Shaheen Afridi's replacement for Asia Cup 2022
194.article_body: Pacer Mohammad Hasnain has been named the replacement for pacer Shaheen Afridi in Pakistan's 15-member squad for Asia Cup 2022. Shaheen was ruled out of Asia Cup after being advised a four to six weeks rest by the medical team following an injury to his right knee ligament. Hasnain is currently in UK, playing for Oval Invincibles in The Hundred.

195.title: I never asked anyone why: Chahal on not being included in India's T20 WC 2021 squad
195.article_body: Talking about being snubbed from Team India's T20 World Cup 2021 squad, Yuzvendra Chahal said, "I never asked anyone why because that's not in my control." He added, "Obviously, you feel bad that you aren't a part of the World Cup, but they might have thought that someone else was better and fair enough."

196.title: Delhi logs 625 new COVID-19 cases, 7 deaths; active infections drop
196.article_body: Delhi on Monday reported 625 new COVID-19 cases with a positivity rate of 9.27%, as per data shared by the health department. The national capital also recorded seven deaths due to the infection. The city witnessed a decline in its active caseload as the active case count dropped from 5,141 on Sunday to 4,645 on Monday, according to available data.

197.title: Man Utd preparing €94 million bid for Ajax winger Antony: Reports
197.article_body: Manchester United are reportedly readying a €94 million bid for manager Erik Ten Hag's long-term target, Ajax winger Antony. The player and the Premier League club have reportedly agreed on personal terms but Ajax are reportedly reluctant to let the forward go. Antony sat out Ajax's last match and has allegedly not been training with the team.

198.title: Road accident kills 4, injures 18 in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur
198.article_body: In the Saharanpur district of UP, a road accident killed at least four and injured 18 people after a speeding car hit a tractor trolley, the police said. The accident took place on the Muzaffarnagar-Saharanpur highway and police rushed to the spot immediately to begin rescue operations, said Deputy Superintendent of Police Ramkaran. Those injured were rushed to a hospital.

199.title: Azaan on loudspeakers doesn't violate fundamental rights of others: K'taka HC
199.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has said that azaan on loudspeakers does not violate the fundamental right of people of other faiths. Hearing a PIL, which claimed that the "contents of the azaan are hurting the believers of other religious faiths", the division bench refused to order mosques to stop playing azaan on loudspeakers. The PIL was filed by Manjunath Halawar.

200.title: Aligarh college students booked for pro-Pak slogans at Tiranga rally
200.article_body: A few college students in Aligarh have been booked on the basis of a video showing them raising pro-Pakistan slogans during a Tiranga rally. The principal and college manager have also been booked after they allegedly took no action when the matter was reported to them. The principal said he received no evidence to back up the claim.

201.title: Railway Board rejects Delhi-Varanasi bullet train feasibility report
201.article_body: The Railway Board has rejected the Delhi-Varanasi bullet train feasibility report in a review meeting that took place last week, officials said. They added that the high-speed train will be unable to run at 350 kmph due to the multiple curves on the route between Delhi and Varanasi. Another official added that the detailed project report (DPR) is awaited.

202.title: Tyson Fury hints at coming out of retirement to fight Oleksandr Usyk
202.article_body: British boxer Tyson Fury has indicated that he is ready to come out of retirement to take on heavyweight champion Oleksandr Usyk. "I'd annihilate both of them...If you want those belts back then...send me in," said Fury on Instagram about the Usyk-Anthony Joshua championship fight. Fury, who is undefeated, had announced his retirement earlier this month.

203.title: Rafael Nadal to be seeded second as Zverev withdraws from US Open
203.article_body: World number two Alexander Zverev has withdrawn from the 2022 US Open due to not recovering from his ankle injury, leaving Rafael Nadal to be seeded second in the draw. Defending champion Daniil Medvedev will keep the top spot. It is still uncertain whether Novak Djokovic will feature in the tournament. The Grand Slam will begin on August 29.

204.title: PM Modi is betraying his own assurances of legally guaranteed MSP: Yechury
204.article_body: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury has criticised PM Narendra Modi for allegedly failing to provide the Minimum Support Price to the country's farmers for their produce. "[PM] Modi is betraying his own assurances of legally guaranteed MSP to all farmers & all crops when their mighty struggle forced the repeal of farm laws. This betrayal will not be allowed," Yechury tweeted.

205.title: Campus Front of India to agitate against education's 'saffronisation' in Karnataka
205.article_body: The Campus Front of India, the student wing of the Popular Front of India, has announced to launch an agitation against the alleged "saffronisation" of education. The student group announced that it will start a month-long campaign called 'Detox Education Deport Hindutva' on August 25. Notably, the campaign will be held across different colleges in Karnataka and elsewhere.

206.title: All Imams coming from outside Assam have to get registered: CM
206.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said "imams and other people coming to madrassas from outside state" have to register their names on a portal. Sarma asked people to notify the police, who would conduct verification if an unknown Imam came to a village. Sarma earlier said tech-savvy foreign terrorists were threatening to turn Assam into an 'Islamist hub'.

207.title: Malik refuses legal aid over refusal for physical court appearance
207.article_body: Jailed separatist leader Yasin Malik has refused legal aid and reiterated his stand on appearing physically for hearings in the killing of four IAF personnel in 1990. Malik is currently in Delhi's Tihar Jail and is attending hearings via video conference. He had gone on a 10-day hunger strike in July against the Centre to accept his demands.

208.title: AAP ignoring excise policy suggestions led to ₹900 crore loss: BJP
208.article_body: The BJP has claimed that AAP did not incorporate recommendations made by the committee it constituted into the new excise policy, leading to at least ₹900 crore loss. They alleged that AAP kept "changing the goalpost" every time tough questions were asked. BJP also refuted Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's claims of getting charges dropped for joining the party.

209.title: Chhattisgarh govt employees on strike to demand DA hike to 34%
209.article_body: Employees of the Chhattisgarh government went on an indefinite strike on Monday demanding that the dearness allowance (DA) be increased to 34% instead of the present 28%. The employees also demanded that the HRA (house rent allowance) be increased on par with that received by central government employees. Recently, the state announced the DA increase by 6 percentage points.

210.title: It was tough watching friends play for India: Samson on being in and out of team
210.article_body: Talking about being in and out of Team India, Sanju Samson said, "To be very honest...I believe everything you go through impacts you in positive manner." He added, "It was tough watching all your friends play for the country...but I really enjoyed playing those domestic games in that period." Samson won Man of the Match award in second Zimbabwe ODI.

211.title: Creator programme Born on Instagram to be available in Kannada
211.article_body: Instagram's creator programme, Born on Instagram (BoI), will be available in Kannada from September after already being available in Malayalam, Hindi and English. To expand it's vision across India, BoI helps creators interact with other influencers and learn to monetise their brand both online and offline. The BoI programme is available on Instagram's website and is free of cost.

212.title: 23-yr-old Pune techie who's Musk's 'Twitter friend' meets the Tesla CEO, shares pic
212.article_body: Pranay Pathole, the 23-year-old Pune techie, who is billionaire Tesla CEO Elon Musk's 'Twitter friend', met Musk at Tesla's Texas factory and shared a picture. "[I have] never seen such a humble and down-to-earth person," said Pathole while sharing a picture from the meeting. "You're an inspiration to millions," Pathole added.

213.title: Gill dedicates 1st int'l ton to father, says 'He schooled me after I got out in 2nd ODI'
213.article_body: Team India opener Shubman Gill on Monday dedicated his first-ever international hundred to his father. After slamming a hundred against Zimbabwe in the third ODI, Shubman said, "My father has been my primary coach. I got a schooling after I got out in the second ODI, so I dedicate this to him." Shubman was dismissed for 33(34) in second ODI.

214.title: Told him not to dive, but realised he is also 'Afridi': Shahid Afridi on Shaheen's injury
214.article_body: A fan requested former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi on Twitter that he should come out of retirement as fast bowler Shaheen Afridi is out injured. Shahid replied, "I had told him that he is a fast bowler and he should not dive as he can get injured. But later I realised he is also 'Afridi'."

215.title: India has over 3,000 deep-tech startups: NASSCOM report
215.article_body: As per a new report by the National Association of Software and Services Companies (NASSCOM), India has become home to over 3,000 deep-tech startups, as of 2021. The deep-tech startups in India have grown at a compounded annual growth rate (CAGR) of 53% over the last 10 years. Comparatively at a nascent stage, they have also employed over 4,000 people.

216.title: Feels good: Rahul after India complete 3-0 ODI series whitewash vs Zimbabwe
216.article_body: Following India's 3-0 ODI series whitewash over Zimbabwe, India captain KL Rahul said it feels good, adding his side came to Harare with good ideas. "We wanted to be out in...middle and use this time. The players have been very professional, very happy with the result," he further said. India beat Zimbabwe by 13 runs in third ODI today.

217.title: Had made 3 nineties but wanted to get a century: Gill on his maiden int'l ton
217.article_body: Speaking about his maiden international ton (130) in third ODI against Zimbabwe, India opener Shubman Gill stated, "It's always special to get a hundred...had made three nineties but wanted to get a century." He added, "I was just trying to minimise my dot-ball percentage, trying to time the ball." Gill was adjudged both 'Player of the Match and Series'.

218.title: BJD welcome to join NDA, says Union Minister Ramdas Athawale
218.article_body: Union Minister and Republican Party of India (Athawale) chief Ramdas Athawale on Monday said that Odisha's ruling Biju Janata Dal (BJD) is welcome to join the National Democratic Alliance (NDA). He highlighted that the NDA-led Centre usually receives BJD's support in the parliament. Athawale added, "[PM] Narendra Modi can allocate more budget for the state's (Odisha) development."

219.title: He will never feel alone when he's around people who love him: Virat Kohli's manager
219.article_body: Following Virat Kohli's interview on mental health wherein he said he sometimes felt alone even in a room full of people who love him, Kohli's manager Bunty Sajdeh said, "He has experienced mental challenges at only a certain stage in his career." He added, "Virat, for one, will never feel alone when he’s around people who love and support him."

220.title: Jupiter's auroras seen in detail in new pics from world's most powerful telescope
220.article_body: The world's most powerful telescope, NASA's James Webb Space Telescope, has taken two new pictures of Jupiter, which captured its auroras and rings in detail. The pictures show Jupiter with its rings which are "a million times fainter than the planet" as well as two tiny moons, ESA said. Galaxies are also seen as "photobombing" one of the pictures.

221.title: Shilpa Shetty does yoga post-fracture in a wheelchair, shares video
221.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty Kundra, who fractured her leg during a shoot, has shared a video of her doing yoga in a wheelchair. "Even though the injury needs me to take it easy, inactivity can make you rusty," she wrote while sharing the video on her Instagram handle. "Don't let anything get in the way of your routine," Shilpa further wrote.

222.title: Number of lawyers have dwindled in Parliament: CJI Ramana
222.article_body: CJI NV Ramana has said that the Parliament was earlier dominated by legal professionals. "As a result, we got outstanding Constitution and flawless laws. Nowadays the number of lawyers has dwindled and that space is taken by others," CJI Ramana said. He added that Jagdeep Dhankhar's elevation to the Vice-President's post is a "tribute to our rich constitutional values".

223.title: SC notice to Gujarat government on Teesta Setalvad's bail plea
223.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) has issued notice to the Gujarat government on a bail plea filed by activist Teesta Setalvad, who was arrested for allegedly fabricating evidence in the 2002 riots cases. The state has been asked to reply by August 25. SC said it'll also consider whether it can give bail while the Gujarat HC is hearing the case.

224.title: Explosives-laden bag found in Swedish capital destroyed by police
224.article_body: Police in Sweden's capital Stockholm disposed of an explosives-filled bag that was found in a park late on Sunday night, they said on Monday. A preliminary investigation has been initiated in the case. No one has been taken in custody so far. The park, where the bag was found, hosted Stockholm's annual cultural festival from August 17 to August 21.

225.title: Fan's 'Can I have your shirt?' banner comes on big screen, Dhawan's reaction goes viral
225.article_body: During the third Zimbabwe-India ODI in Harare, the big screen showed a fan holding a poster that read, "Shikhar...can I have your shirt?" The camera then showed Shikhar Dhawan sitting in the dressing room. On seeing the big screen, Shikhar pretended to remove his shirt, after which teammates around him were seen laughing. India won the ODI by 13 runs.

226.title: Ex-Punjab minister arrested from salon on corruption charges
226.article_body: Punjab Congress Working President and former state minister Bharat Bhushan Ashu was arrested from a hair salon in Ludhiana on corruption charges. Ashu, who was the food and supplies minister, was arrested in connection with the food grains transportation tender case. A video showed Ashu sitting on a chair in the salon, while vigilance officials arrived to arrest him.

227.title: 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' to re-release in theatres with additional footage
227.article_body: Tom Holland's 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' is returning to the theatres with an extended version. Sony Pictures on Monday announced that the film will be re-released on September 2 and will feature "with all-new additional footage", which didn't make it in the first theatrical cut. In India, the film will release in English and Hindi.

228.title: An influential personality made fake promise of a film: Asim
228.article_body: Actor Asim Riaz said an "influential personality" made "fake promises" to his father of a film. He said for more than a year, the makers used his name to bring the film under media's limelight. "The pressure and anxiety they have given me will never make me stop doing what I am doing right now," he said.

229.title: Man rapes & kills girl, mutilates her face after she sees him with her mother in Delhi
229.article_body: A man has been arrested in Delhi for kidnapping, raping and murdering a minor girl whose mother was in a relationship with the accused, police said. The accused committed the crime after the victim saw him in "a compromising position" with her mother, said Delhi DCP Shweta Chauhan. He also mutilated the girl's face and hid her body, Chauhan said.

230.title: Tiger's 'Screw Dheela' not shelved, shoot to commence in 2023: Makers
230.article_body: The makers of Tiger Shroff-starrer 'Screw Dheela' have issued a statement refuting reports that claimed that the film has been shelved due to budget issues and average response to the film's announcement video. The statement shared by the makers clarified that the film has been delayed due to date issues. 'Screw Dheela' will go on floors in 2023, it said.

231.title: Manipur minor allegedly raped by father succumbs after suicide bid
231.article_body: A 15-year-old girl who was allegedly raped by her father several times since 2016 and attempted suicide by consuming poison died of multiple organ failure in a hospital in Manipur's capital Imphal on Sunday. The victim had allegedly consumed pesticide on July 31 and was hospitalised on August 3. The accused is currently under judicial custody.

232.title: Ananya gives acting tips to Shanaya & Suhana: Actress' mom Bhavana
232.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday's mother Bhavana Pandey has said her daughter gives acting tips to her friends Shanaya Kapoor and Suhana Khan. "Ananya has a lot of learning to do still but whatever she has learned...she's sharing...with Shanaya and Suhana," Bhavana added. Shanaya will make her debut with 'Bedhadak' while Zoya Akhtar's 'The Archies' will mark Suhana's acting debut.

233.title: Congress' internal condition is in shambles: Scindia on Sharma's exit
233.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Monday joined the discussion around Congress leader Anand Sharma's exit as the Chairman of the Steering Committee for Himachal polls and said that Congress' internal condition is in shambles. Sharma, while tendering his resignation, said that he had no choice but to resign "due to continuous insults and exclusion".

234.title: Siddaramaiah ate meat before visiting temple, it's an insult: BJP
234.article_body: BJP leaders in Karnataka have criticised Congress leader Siddaramaiah for reportedly going to a temple after eating non-vegetarian food and have accused him of hurting religious sentiments. "Siddaramaiah or anyone should not hurt the feelings of the faithful. If you (Siddaramaiah) have guts, eat pork and visit a mosque," said BJP MLA Basanagouda Patil Yatnal.

235.title: 15 Chinese nationals illegally staying in India detained in UP
235.article_body: Fifteen Chinese nationals staying without valid visas in Uttar Pradesh's Gautam Buddha Nagar district were detained by police on Monday. "They are being sent to a detention centre in Delhi and will be subsequently deported to their country," police said in a statement. This comes after a Chinese national, who was staying illegally in Greater Noida, was arrested in June.

236.title: Kerala's gender-neutral education policy will bring decency into classrooms: BJP
236.article_body: BJP leader and former Union Minister KJ Alphons has said that the Kerala government's gender-neutral education policy in schools will bring "decency" into the classrooms. "The move of the Kerala government towards gender equality is a good thing. Boys and girls will sit together. They don't need to meet one another as strangers," Alphons said.

237.title: Principal arrested for molesting 17-year-old student in Amethi
237.article_body: A private school principal has been arrested for allegedly molesting a 17-year-old female student of his school in UP's Amethi. The incident took place when the girl was reportedly asked by the accused to come to school during a holiday to fill out a form. The police have charged the accused under relevant IPC and POCSO sections.

238.title: A job well done: Jaffer on India's 3-0 ODI series whitewash over Zimbabwe
238.article_body: After India whitewashed Zimbabwe 3-0 following their 13-run win in third ODI in Harare, Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter and wrote, "A job well done. Congratulations Team India on the clinical series win." He added, "Also Sikandar Raza is a special player, gave the passionate Harare crowd lots to cheer [for]." Zimbabwe were bowled out for 276 in 49.3 overs.

239.title: Congo confirms new case of Ebola linked to 2018 outbreak
239.article_body: A confirmed case of Ebola has been detected in Beni city, Congo's National Institute for Biomedical Research said on Monday. Through genetic sequencing, the case was found to be linked to the 2018-2020 outbreak in North Kivu province, the institute informed. WHO earlier said that a suspected case was under investigation after a woman with Ebola-like symptoms died in Beni.

240.title: Security increased in Punjab's Mohali ahead of PM's visit on Aug 24
240.article_body: Punjab Police have increased security in Mohali in the wake of PM Narendra Modi’s visit on August 24. PM Modi will inaugurate the Homi Bhabha Cancer Hospital and Research Centre at Mohali's Mullanpur. During PM Modi's visit to Punjab in January this year, his convoy was disrupted and he was stuck on a flyover near Ferozepur for over 15 minutes.

241.title: My best results come when I'm smiling, having fun: US Open champion Raducanu
241.article_body: Talking about the advice she would like to give her younger self ahead of US Open 2022, 19-year-old Emma Raducanu said, "I'd say to have fun because it just makes what you're doing so enjoyable." She added, "My best results come when I'm smiling, enjoying it and having fun." Raducanu won the women's singles title at US Open last year.

242.title: Ukraine's football league to restart, all stadiums to have bomb shelters
242.article_body: Amid the war with Russia, Ukraine's football league is set to begin as Shakhtar Donetsk will play Metalist 1925 in Kharkiv on Tuesday. "This will be a unique competition: It will happen during a war, during military aggression, during bombardments," said Ukraine's football association head. All matches will be played near Kyiv and all stadiums will have a bomb shelter.

243.title: Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan shares 1st post on Instagram since cruise drugs case
243.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan took to Instagram to share his first post since the cruise drugs case in which he was arrested last year. Sharing pictures with his brother AbRam and sister Suhana, he wrote, "Hat-trick." Shah Rukh commented on the post, writing, "Why I don’t have these pictures!!!!!! Give them to me NOW!"

244.title: China to start issuing visas to Indian students again after over 2 years
244.article_body: China has announced plans to issue visas for Indian students wishing to go back to study in China, after over two years of delay due to COVID-19 restrictions. The new relaxed visa rules will come into effect from August 24 onward, the Chinese embassy in India said. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar had earlier raised the issue with China.

245.title: Abhishek, Anees Bazmee attend Abdul Gaffar Nadiadwala's funeral
245.article_body: Celebrities including Abhishek Bachchan, Anees Bazmee, Madhur Bhandarkar and Sajid Nadiadwala attended the funeral of late producer Abdul Gaffar Nadiadwala, who passed away aged 91. He was known for producing films like 'Welcome', 'Hera Pheri' and 'Lahoo Ke Do Rang'. He died early Monday morning due to cardiac arrest at Breach Candy Hospital in Mumbai.

246.title: Man Utd-bound Casemiro breaks down as he bids farewell to Real Madrid
246.article_body: Brazilian midfielder Casemiro broke down as he bid farewell to La Liga club Real Madrid after being with them for nine years. "When I got here...my wife and I knew nobody...the greatest honour was to come here to work every day," said Casemiro. The player agreed a transfer to Manchester United in a deal reported to be worth £70 million.

247.title: Prabhas' next with Siddharth Anand to go on floors mid-2023: Reports
247.article_body: Prabhas is reportedly collaborating with director Siddharth Anand for his next action-thriller. As per reports, the film will go on floors in mid-2023 after Prabhas and Siddharth wrap their respective projects. The film, which reportedly will be produced by Mythri Movie Makers, is said to be a big budgeted project. It will be shot in India and abroad.

248.title: Prepared for everything now: Shehnaaz on life post Sidharth’s demise
248.article_body: Shehnaaz Gill said Sidharth Shukla's death has prepared her for everything to come. The actress said the grief she has experienced last year has made her "very strong" as a person. Addressing the trolling against her song 'Tu Yaheen Hai', which was released after Sidharth's death, Shehnaaz said it was her way to pay tribute to him before resuming work.

249.title: Used to find my right profile 'ugly', would ask photographers to not shoot: Vidya
249.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan on Instagram recalled the times when she would request filmmakers or photographers to not shoot her right profile as she found it "ugly". But with time, Vidya said she is "no longer scared" to flaunt all her sides. "What changed is the way I looked at myself and that changed how I see myself," she said.

250.title: Always wanted to do a Dharma film: Arjun Bijlani on ‘Rocky Aur Rani…’
250.article_body: Actor Arjun Bijlani will be seen in Karan Johar's film 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'. While the film stars him in a guest appearance, Arjun said he hopes "to do bigger things" under Dharma Productions. "From childhood...I wanted to do a Dharma film," he said, adding that being in the Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt-starrer was his "Dharma moment".

251.title: I think Shakib is going to re-energise Bangladesh: Shane Watson
251.article_body: After Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan was appointed as the skipper for the upcoming Asia Cup, former Australian cricketer Shane Watson said that the move is going to "re-energise" the team. "He's (Shakib) so experienced...His decision-making...under pressure is going to be invaluable," Watson said. He added that he will be "very surprised" if Shakib doesn't "dominate" the Asia Cup.

252.title: Shanghai United Imaging shares jump 75% after $1.6 bn IPO
252.article_body: Pharmaceutical company Shanghai United Imaging shares surged 75% to 192.48 yuan on the first day of trading after its $1.6 billion Initial Public Offering (IPO). The company raised 10.99 billion yuan in its IPO which was more than 3,500 times oversubscribed among retail investors. This is seventh Chinese listing this year that has an offering of more than $1 billion.

253.title: Police lathicharge Raj students gathered for student election rally
253.article_body: Police on Monday lathicharged students, who had allegedly gathered without permission on university and college campuses in several cities in Rajasthan, during filing of nominations for the students' union elections. Narendra Yadav, ABVP candidate for the President's post in Jaipur's Rajasthan University, held a show of strength with a large number of his supporters during nomination, police said.

254.title: 'Brahmastra 2' to feature Deepika-Ranveer with Alia-Ranbir: Reports
254.article_body: Ahead of Brahmastra Part One's release, rumours are suggesting that the sequel of the Ayan Mukerji trilogy will feature Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh in pivotal roles. As per reports, Deepika-Ranveer's story will run parallel to Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's story in 'Brahmastra 2'. The trilogy will reportedly be interlinked with many actors featuring in cameos.

255.title: I think it's great, you get used to each other: Alia on live-in relationships
255.article_body: Alia Bhatt during a recent interview opened up about the concept of live-in relationships, saying, "If you can, why not? I think it's great." "You get used to each other, you get comfortable, you build so many memories without the pressure and that baggage or like 'shaadi karni hai (we want to get married)'. To each his own," Alia added.

256.title: Skye Air to focus on long range delivery of medicines in Kolkata
256.article_body: Drone startup Skye Air Mobility in partnership with Flipkart Health+ will be taking up long range deliveries of medicines at a distance of 60-70 km in Kolkata and suburban areas as part of its ongoing trials. So far, Skye Mobility was delivering medicines at a maximum distance of 16 km. The trials will go on till September 8, 2022.

257.title: Odisha govt must check atrocities on Dalits and tribals: Athawale
257.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale has urged the Odisha government to "take steps to check atrocities" on Dalits and tribals in the state. Addressing a press conference in Bhubaneswar, Athawale said that Odisha recorded 2,828 cases of crime against Dalits and tribals in 2020-21. He added that there was a need to encourage inter-caste marriages to end discrimination.

258.title: Adidas CEO Kasper Rorsted to step down in 2023
258.article_body: Adidas announced that its CEO Kasper Rorsted will be stepping down next year. Rorsted, who led Adidas since 2016, will remain in the position till his successor is found, Adidas said. His contract was renewed for five years in 2020. "Enabling a restart in 2023 is the right thing to do, both for the company and me personally," Rorsted said.

259.title: Cong 'unanimously' in Rahul's favour for party President post: Raj CM
259.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday said the party is "unanimously" in favour of Rahul Gandhi becoming the next Congress President. "If Rahul Gandhi does not become the party President, it will be a disappointment for Congress supporters in the country. Many people will sit at home and we will suffer," CM Gehlot said.

260.title: Nearly 9,000 personnel lost in war with Russia: Ukrainian general
260.article_body: General Valeriy Zaluzhnyi, chief of Ukrainian armed forces, on Monday said Ukraine has lost nearly 9,000 military personnel in the ongoing war with Russia. Zaluzhnyi did not specify if the figure included all service personnel killed in action, such as border guards. Notably, Ukraine on Sunday claimed that 45,000 Russian military personnel had been killed in the conflict thus far.

261.title: Binged 'Game of Thrones' in 2 weeks: House of the Dragon's Milly Alcock
261.article_body: 'House of the Dragon' actress Milly Alcock said she "binged" all eight seasons of 'Game of Thrones' in two weeks to prepare herself for its prequel. She said she found it "intense" and understood why everyone loved it. Alcock said she was in "shock and disbelief" to find out that she will play Rhaenyra Targaryen in the show.

262.title: Not doing it due to agreement issues: Krushna on 'The Kapil Sharma Show'
262.article_body: 'The Kapil Sharma Show' (TKSS), which is returning with its new season, will not feature Krushna Abhishek. The actor confirmed the news and said, "Not doing it. Agreement issues." The upcoming season of the Kapil Sharma-hosted show will introduce the audience to some new artistes. The makers will soon officially announce the show's premiere date.

263.title: BCB President Nazmul Hassan keeps me under pressure: Shakib Al Hasan
263.article_body: Bangladesh skipper Shakib Al Hasan said that BCB President Nazmul Hassan keeps him "under pressure". "So there is some chance of pressure being there. Since it's a challenging position and the board felt that I was the best option available, maybe that's why they chose me," Shakib said. The all-rounder has been appointed as the skipper for the Asia Cup.

264.title: How much prize money did Praggnanandhaa win from event in which he defeated Carlsen?
264.article_body: India's 17-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen in the FTX Crypto Cup. Praggnanandhaa also defeated world number four Alireza Firouzja, world number nine Anish Giri and world number six Levon Aronian in the tournament. Praggnanandhaa bagged a total prize money of $37,500 in the event after finishing runner-up. Champion Magnus Carlsen won $40,000.

265.title: I believe in coming back to drawing board when things don't go my way: Iyer
265.article_body: All-rounder Venkatesh Iyer, who hasn't played for India since February 2022, said he always believes in coming back to the drawing board and working on his basics when things don't go his way. "I'm working on my fitness and...bowling so that I can add a few clicks to my pace...You need to keep on upgrading yourself," he added.

266.title: 'Sab golmaal hai': BJP shares parody video of Kejriwal
266.article_body: The BJP recently shared a parody video of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and titled it "Golmaal hai bhai sab golmaal hai". The video implies that CM Kejriwal is directly behind corruption in the national capital. The video comes amid a political battle between BJP and AAP over Manish Sisodia's role in the excise policy scam.

267.title: Drunk woman abuses & manhandles auto driver alleging harassment on MP road, video out
267.article_body: A video has shown a woman, who was reportedly drunk, abusing and manhandling an auto driver on a busy road in MP's Gwalior. The woman reportedly got down from the scooter she was riding and started abusing the driver, alleging harassment and eve-teasing on Sunday. She didn't stop even after police were called to the spot.

268.title: Paytm shares jump over 3% after reappointment of Vijay Shekhar Sharma
268.article_body: The share price of the parent company of Paytm, One 97 Communications, rose over 3% after the reappointment of Vijay Shekhar Sharma as the company's Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and Managing Director (MD). 99.67% shareholders of the company voted in favour of the reappointment at company's annual general meeting on August 21. The stock has lost 41.2% in 2022.

269.title: Saudi BNPL platform Tamara raises $100 mn in Series B round
269.article_body: Saudi Arabian buy now, pay later (BNPL) platform, Tamara, has raised $100 million in a Series B funding round. The round was led by Sanabil Investments, which is owned by Saudi Arabia's sovereign fund. Founded in 2020 by Saudi entrepreneurs Abdulmajeed Alsukhan, Turki Bin Zarah and Abdulmohsen Albabtain, Tamara has partnered with companies such as IKEA, SHEIN and Namshi.

270.title: India create record for most ODI series whitewashes in 2022, defeat Zimbabwe 3-0
270.article_body: India defeated Zimbabwe by 13 runs in the third ODI in Harare to complete a 3-0 series whitewash. With this, India created the record for most ODI series whitewashes in 2022 with 3 clean sweeps. India had earlier completed two ODI series whitewashes against West Indies. New Zealand, Pakistan and Afghanistan have registered two ODI series whitewashes each this year.

271.title: Jacqueline makes 1st public appearance since being named accused in extortion case
271.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez was spotted in Mumbai on Monday for the first time since she was named as an accused in an extortion case. Last week, Jacqueline was named in the chargesheet filed by the ED in the ₹200-crore extortion case connected to conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar. On Monday, Jacqueline was seen at a temple paying her respects.

272.title: At least 20 dead due to flash floods in Afghanistan
272.article_body: Flash floods have killed at least 20 people in the Logar province of Afghanistan over the last 48 hours, the country's disaster management authority said on Monday. Another 35 people have been injured due to the flooding, officials added. Notably, more than 1,000 people were killed in a massive earthquake that hit the country in June this year.

273.title: Indian YouTubers tweet 'chess is the new cricket'; world number 1 Carlsen reacts
273.article_body: After India's R Praggnanandhaa defeated world number 1 chess player Magnus Carlsen, Indian YouTubers, Abhi and Niyu, tweeted, "Chess is the new cricket. Prove me wrong!" Carlsen reacted to the tweet, listing reasons "why chess isn't cricket", and said, "Cricket is played on a field...chess is played on a board...Cricket has bat and ball, chess...doesn't...I can't play cricket."

274.title: 12 people missing in U'khand amid heavy rain; sniffer dogs deployed
274.article_body: The Uttarakhand State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) on Monday deployed four sniffer dogs in Sarkhet village to trace 12 people, who are feared trapped under debris for over 48 hours, SDRF Commandant Manikant Mishra said. Torrential rainfall had caused severe damage to properties in Dehradun and Tehri Garhwal districts, the official added. Sarkhet was struck by a cloudburst on Saturday.

275.title: Indians Srikanth, Prannoy reach 2nd round at World Championships 2022
275.article_body: India's Kidambi Srikanth defeated Nhat Nguyen of Ireland 22-20, 21-19 to enter the men's singles second round at Badminton World Championships 2022 in Tokyo on Monday. The 2021 silver medallist won the match in 51 minutes. Unseeded Indian HS Prannoy defeated Luka Wraber of Austria 21-12, 21-11. In the men's doubles, MR Arjun and Dhruv Kapila entered the second round.

276.title: Mamata announces 11-day Puja holidays, ₹60,000 grant for Puja clubs
276.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday announced government holidays for Durga Puja from September 30 to October 10. She also added that the Puja committees will get financial assistance of ₹60,000, an increase of ₹10,000 from last year. "We will also provide them a rebate of 60% on the electricity bill," Banerjee added.

277.title: Sidharth & Kiara in talks for Shashank Khaitan's rom-com film: Report
277.article_body: Actors Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani, who are rumoured to be dating each other, are reportedly in talks for a rom-com film which will be directed by Shashank Khaitan. The upcoming film will go on the floors by the end of this year, the report said. It will be produced by Karan Johar's Dharma Productions, the report further said.

278.title: 3 bathing in rivers drown in Nainital in 2 incidents; 1 missing
278.article_body: Three persons, including two teenagers, who went into rivers for a bath drowned in two separate incidents in Uttarakhand's Nainital in the last 24 hours, police said on Monday, adding that a fourth person is still missing. In one of the incidents, some children raised an alarm after spotting the two teenagers being washed away due to strong water currents.

279.title: Beating Nadal in middle of tournament felt great: Cincinnati Open champ Coric
279.article_body: Asked about his thoughts on winning match after match at Cincinnati Open 2022, including one against Rafael Nadal, champion Borna Coric said he felt great after beating the 22-time Grand Slam champion in middle of the tournament. "I was just believing that I can win the next match. That's what I did for five days in a row," he added.

280.title: Pique among Barca players not happy with Dembele's new contract: Reports
280.article_body: Barcelona players Gerard Pique, Sergio Busquets, and Jordi Alba are reportedly not happy after details of winger Ousmane Dembele's new contract came to light. The three senior players have taken salary cuts over the last two years to help the team register new players. Meanwhile, leaks suggest Dembele has clauses in his contract which could see him earn £20 million/season.

281.title: Kejriwal is a 'big liar', his Ministers are 'bigger' liars: BJP
281.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Anurag Thakur on Monday called Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal a "big liar" and his Ministers "bigger liars". His remark came following Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's claim that BJP offered him the CM's post if he broke AAP. Kejriwal's model of governance has shifted from "mohalla clinics" to "mohalla thekas", Thakur added.

282.title: 4 killed, 11 injured as truck rams into SUV carrying students in MP
282.article_body: Four students died and 11 others sustained injuries after a speeding truck rammed into an SUV carrying 15 school students in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain on Monday, police said. Eyewitnesses said an ambulance reached the spot 15 minutes after the incident and passersby took the students to a hospital in a passenger bus. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has condoled the deaths.

283.title: Runner-up Odinga challenges Kenya's Prez poll result in top court
283.article_body: Raila Odinga, runner-up of Kenyan presidential polls, on Monday challenged the election results in the Supreme Court. In his petition, Odinga sought nullification of the vote's outcome. He argued that there was a mismatch between the turnout figures and the result. He further contended that the election commission had failed to tally ballots from 27 constituencies as required by law.

284.title: Tired of my 'dabang' reputation, it gets me into trouble unnecessarily: Swara
284.article_body: Swara Bhasker, who'll be seen alongside Shikha Talsania, Meher Vij and Pooja Chopra in 'Jahaan Chaar Yaar', has said she asked the film's writer-director Kamal Pandey to give her the "most shy" character in the film. "I told him...I'm tired of this 'dabang' reputation of mine. I'm fed up of this reputation, which gets me into trouble unnecessarily," Swara added.

285.title: Women share videos of themselves partying in Finland after PM Sanna criticised
285.article_body: Women in Finland are sharing videos of themselves dancing and partying to show support for PM Sanna Marin who was criticised after a video of her partying with her friends went viral. The women are sharing the video with the hashtag 'Solidarity with Sanna' on Twitter. Marin was accused of taking drugs after the video went viral.

286.title: 4-yr-old Gurugram girl gets raped after being lured with toffees
286.article_body: A four-year-old girl was allegedly molested and forced to have oral sex with a 23-year-old man in Gurugram. The accused, Sahil alias Nitu, allegedly took the girl to his home after enticing her with toffees, the victim's mother wrote in her complaint. She further alleged that Sahil often molested the minor. The accused has been arrested under the POCSO Act.

287.title: Rajinikanth's first look from 'Jailer' revealed, film goes on floors
287.article_body: The makers of 'Jailer' shared actor Rajinikanth's first look from the Nelson Dilipkumar directorial on Twitter. They also shared that the film went on the floors in Chennai on Monday. The film, which also stars Tamannaah Bhatia and Sanjay Dutt in pivotal roles, marks Rajinikanth's first collaboration with Nelson. It will reportedly be shot entirely on a prison set.

288.title: Heavy rains cause flood-like situation in Kota; schools closed
288.article_body: Heavy rainfall in the last 24 hours has caused a flood-like situation in parts of Rajasthan's Kota and nearby areas like Bundi, Baran, Jhalawar and Tonk. The Kota district administration said that nearly 1,500 people from different parts of the district have been moved and sent to safer places. Schools in the district have also been closed till further orders.

289.title: India's Deepak Chahar 'mankads' Zimbabwe opener, doesn't appeal; video goes viral
289.article_body: A video has gone viral showing India fast bowler Deepak Chahar 'mankading' Zimbabwe opener Innocent Kaia at the start of Zimbabwe's innings in the third ODI in Harare. Chahar removed the bails in his run-up while Innocent was outside his crease. However, Chahar did not appeal and was seen having a word with Innocent, seemingly giving him a warning.

290.title: Hindi films need course correction: Manoj Bajpayee
290.article_body: Commenting on Bollywood's "bad phase" at the box office, actor Manoj Bajpayee said the Hindi film industry needs "course correction". Stating that "Hindi cinema will not die", the actor said, "It will course-correct and come back to its normal self" and will witness a "new exciting phase". His comment came after 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan' failed to perform.

291.title: Bollywood has been painted as a dark place after Sushant's death: Swara
291.article_body: Swara Bhasker has spoken about the social media trends demanding boycott of Bollywood films. She claimed the current trend is to spew hate toward Bollywood which gained momentum post Sushant Singh Rajput's demise. "After unfortunate...suicide of Sushant, Bollywood has been painted as a dark place, that is only about drug, alcohol and sex...Unfortunately, Bollywood is being discredited," she said.

292.title: Several hurt as JNU students, staff clash over scholarships; video surfaces
292.article_body: Clashes broke out on the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) campus in Delhi on Monday between students, led by the Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP), and staff members over scholarship funds. The ABVP has claimed the administration "attacked students for asking for their rightful fellowships". "Many students have been seriously injured," ABVP tweeted, while sharing a video of the incident.

293.title: 3 people, including father and son, killed with spade in Jharkhand
293.article_body: Three people, including a father and his son, were allegedly killed by a relative in Chandidih village in Jharkhand's Khunti district. The accused, Hemant Purty, allegedly used a spade in killing them and was intoxicated while committing the crime, police said. The deceased have been identified as Bitna Munda (65), Suda Munda (25) and Vikas Mahto.

294.title: Girls, boys sitting together in classroom won't lead to gender equality: Cong
294.article_body: Senior Congress leader K Muraleedharan on Sunday said making girls and boys sit together in the classroom will not lead to gender equality. "Not everyone would welcome it. It is not just the Indian Union Muslim League (IUML) which is against it. A lot of people in Kerala have not accepted that concept. It is unnecessary," he said.

295.title: She was an icon: Adnan Sami mourns demise of Pak singer Nayyara Noor
295.article_body: Singer Adnan Sami took to Twitter to share a post mourning the demise of Pakistani singer Nayyara Noor. "Just learned the sad news that legendary singer Nayyara Noor Sahiba has passed away. She was an icon and her contribution to music will be remembered and loved forever," he wrote. Nayyara passed away on Sunday at the age of 71.

296.title: 1 booked after Hanuman idol vandalised in Delhi's Mahendra Park
296.article_body: A case has been registered against a person for allegedly vandalising a Hanuman idol at a small temple in northwest Delhi's Mahendra Park area, police said. A video showing a man with a rod near the temple was reportedly accessed by locals. Police suspect that the accused vandalised the idol in a drunken stupor. He is yet to be arrested.

297.title: India Women are also as talented as other teams: Batter Yastika Bhatia
297.article_body: Speaking about India Women's mindset against England Women in semi-final at CWG 2022, India Women batter Yastika Bhatia said her side had certain plans against certain batters and bowlers and had practised accordingly. "It was all about executing that well on...ground. We're also as talented as other teams...it was all about holding our nerves in crunch situations," she added.

298.title: Supreme Court agrees to hear review petition of PMLA judgement
298.article_body: The Supreme Court has agreed to list a review petition against its earlier judgement which upheld the constitutional validity of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act. When the plea was mentioned, a bench headed by Chief Justice NV Ramana said, "Okay, we will list it." Following the previous verdict, various Opposition parties expressed their apprehension over its 'long-term implications'.

299.title: Maharashtra govt to pay fees of college students who lost both parents to COVID-19
299.article_body: The Maharashtra government will bear the education cost of college students who've lost both their parents to COVID-19, state Minister Chandrakant Patil said. "As many as 931 undergraduate and 228 postgraduate students of various government colleges have lost both their parents to COVID-19," Patil announced in the state Assembly. This will cost the state exchequer over ₹2 crore annually.

300.title: Man throws egg at Ganpati procession in Mumbai; arrested
300.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly throwing an egg at a Ganpati procession in Mumbai's Kamathipura area on Sunday. A crowd gathered at the spot soon after the incident took place. The police said that there was no communal issue in the area and the matter was resolved immediately.

301.title: 50 'bee hotels' installed in B'luru, bee population being sampled
301.article_body: Scientists at Ashoka Trust for Research in Ecology and the Environment (ATREE) have placed 50 "bee hotels" across Bengaluru to integrate bees into urban spaces and encourage conservation efforts. The scientists have begun sampling the city's bee population. The decline in bee population due to human interference could not be ascertained earlier as sampling has never been carried out before.

302.title: Director N Lingusamy, his brother sentenced to 6 months in jail in cheque fraud case
302.article_body: 'The Warriorr' director N Lingusamy and his brother N Subash Chandra Bose have been sentenced to six months in jail in a cheque fraud case. The case was filed against the brothers by a production company after they didn't repay over ₹1 crore they had taken from them. The brothers had given a cheque to the production company, which bounced.

303.title: Friends insert steel glass inside man at a party in Gujarat, pic of X-ray surfaces
303.article_body: A man's friends inserted a steel glass inside him through his rectum during a party in Gujarat's Surat. The man, who hails from Odisha, was in a drunken state when the incident happened. He returned to Odisha and got it surgically removed after 10 days at Brahmapur's MKCG Medical College And Hospital. A picture of his X-ray has surfaced online.

304.title: Job aspirant holding Tricolour thrashed and caned by Patna ADM in public, video surfaces
304.article_body: A video of Patna ADM KK Singh beating up and caning a job aspirant in public has surfaced online. In the video, the aspiring teacher can be seen holding the National Flag and lying on the road. KK Singh can be seen thrashing him with a stick and caning him. The job aspirant has been admitted to a hospital.

305.title: Sequoia’s Surge selects 15 Indian, SEA startups for its 7th cohort
305.article_body: Sequoia India and Sequoia Southeast Asia's rapid scale-up programme Surge launched its seventh cohort of 15 startups and has invested a total of $41 million. The startups in this cohort are mostly focused on software and deep-tech firms and there is no investment in edtech or Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) segments. According to a statement, Surge 07 is a 16-week hybrid programme.

306.title: 8-yr-old Delhi girl missing for 2 weeks found dead with her throat slit
306.article_body: The body of an eight-year-old girl, who was missing for two weeks, was found near Delhi's Yamuna Khadar area, police said on Sunday. The girl had gone missing on August 5, police said, adding that the girl was gagged and her throat slit. It is also suspected that a known person committed the crime, a police official said.

307.title: Evacuations ordered, schools shut over heavy rains in Odisha, MP
307.article_body: Heavy rains triggered massive floods and caused swelling of rivers in Odisha, due to which authorities evacuated 1.2 lakh people in Balasore and Mayurbhanj districts in two days. Meanwhile, in Madhya Pradesh, many parts witnessed heavy rainfall, resulting in closure of schools. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) said that Bay of Bengal will witness a deep depression from August 23.

308.title: You seriously deserved that: Yuvraj to Shubman on his 1st international ton
308.article_body: Congratulating India opener Shubman Gill on his maiden international century against Zimbabwe in the third ODI, Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter and wrote, "Finally!!! Well played Shubman, you seriously deserved that ton!" He added, "Many more to come, this is just a start." The 22-year-old scored 130 runs in 97 balls in Harare today.

309.title: PM Modi will lose in 2024 if he doesn't file affidavit in Ram Setu case: Swamy
309.article_body: BJP member Subramanian Swamy has commented on the ongoing Supreme Court case where he seeks for “Ram Setu” to be granted the status of national heritage. “The [Supreme Court]...directed to Govt to file a yes no affidavit. If yes, then [it’s] my victory. If no, then it [is PM Narendra] Modi’s defeat in 2024 [Lok Sabha polls],” Swamy tweeted.

310.title: 4 dead, 2 lose eyesight after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar
310.article_body: Four people died, while two others lost eyesight after allegedly consuming poisonous liquor at two villages in Bihar's Rohtas. Those who died include a 72-year-old retired circle inspector. Officials were camping in the area and conducting raids against the liquor mafia. A police officer said 12 mafia members were arrested and 212 litres of liquor was seized in two days.

311.title: Bihar staring at worst-ever drought in last 5 decades: state Agriculture Minister
311.article_body: Bihar Agriculture Minister Sudhakar Singh said with 40% deficient rains and paddy sowing being hit, Bihar is staring at perhaps the "worst-ever drought in the last five decades". The Indian Express quoted him as saying, "CM Nitish Kumar and I have been moving in the field to make the assessment on the ground and are finding the situation very alarming."

312.title: 'Delhi model' is to give honesty certificates to corrupts: Thakur
312.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur questioned Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal’s silence over corruption charges against his deputy and asserted that Kejriwal's Delhi model is to award honesty certificates to dishonest ministers. “Kejriwal model decoded. You spend hundreds of crores of rupees to do publicity with no accountability. And when you get caught, you fix the liability on someone else,” said Thakur.

313.title: Won't accept inclusion of non-locals, would end J&K's identity: Abdullah
313.article_body: Former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah on Monday said the "inclusion of non-local voters" in the electoral rolls of J&K was not acceptable to the parties and that it would end the union territory's identity. "The Assembly will be in the hands of the outsiders and the people here will be denied," Abdullah said.

314.title: I'm seeking justice, man who said he loved her maligning her image: Jiah's mother
314.article_body: Late actress Jiah Khan's mother Rabia stated that she is like any mother seeking justice for her daughter. "The man who claimed to love her is maligning her image...The accused is hiding," she said. Jiah committed suicide in 2013 and blamed her former partner Sooraj Pancholi in her suicide note. Rabia has testified that Sooraj verbally and physically abused Jiah.

315.title: Form is temporary, class is permanent: De Villiers on Kohli ahead of Asia Cup
315.article_body: Ex-SA wicketkeeper-batter AB De Villiers has said Virat Kohli doesn't need anyone to tell him to work hard to come out of his poor form. "Form is temporary, class is permanent...Virat and I remain in regular contact. We're friends, and he certainly doesn't need me to tell him the importance of working hard during a bad patch," stated De Villiers.

316.title: Sisodia deserves Bharat Ratna instead CBI raid conducted against him: Kejriwal
316.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said his deputy Manish Sisodia deserves the "Bharat Ratna". "He (Manish Sisodia) reformed government schools which other parties could not do in 70 years. Such a person should get Bharat Ratna," Kejriwal added. "The entire country's education system should be handed over to him but instead, they conducted CBI raid against him," he stated.

317.title: Pune Rural Police arrest man for raping 16-year-old
317.article_body: A man was arrested by the Pune Rural Police for raping a 16-year-old girl, after her mother lodged a First Information Report (FIR), officials said. The accused, aged 25, was booked on rape charges under the Indian Penal Code (IPC) and Prevention of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act. The police also added that the accused and victim are neighbours.

318.title: Assailants on a bike shoot 27-yr-old man in broad daylight in Pune
318.article_body: Two motorcycle-borne assailants shot down a 27-year-old conservancy truck worker in broad daylight, in Pune city's Chandan Nagar area, the police said. The deceased, identified as Akshay Prakash Bhise, was killed while he was on his way to work. Police officials said that efforts are on to arrest the accused, and the area's CCTV footage is being checked for clues.

319.title: She was harassed, didn't imagine this: Dad of UP woman who's body was found
319.article_body: Days after the body of a 25-year old woman was found on a railway track in Uttar Pradesh, the father of the deceased said that she was being harassed for dowry after her wedding. "We tried to settle the issue...we had not imagined that they would kill her by throwing her before a moving train," he said.

320.title: Largest shipment of fentanyl seized in Australia; 5 million doses recovered
320.article_body: Australian Federal Police (AFP) in a joint operation with Australian Border Force (ABF) have seized the largest shipment of fentanyl ever detected in the country and recovered over five million doses of the opioid, ABF said in a statement on Monday. Over 11 kg of pure fentanyl and about 30 kg of methamphetamine were hidden in the shipment, it added.

321.title: Standup comedians, Hyd-linked traders being probed in Delhi liquor scam: Report
321.article_body: Standup comedians, Hyderabad-linked wholesale and retail traders and corporate entities sharing similar Mumbai addresses are being probed in alleged Delhi liquor licensing scam, reports quoted officials as saying. CBI, after conducting searches in locations including Mumbai, Delhi and Hyderabad, filed FIR against 15 people, two companies and "other unknown public servants and private persons".

322.title: Workers in Argentina hold 'funeral' for their wages, pics surface
322.article_body: Several workers in Argentina held a protest demanding government action to boost salaries and unemployment benefits amid higher inflation. They held a symbolic funeral for their wages. "The paycheck has died," read a banner, while another placard read, "RIP the minimum wage". The country’s official monthly minimum wage stands at 45,540 Argentine pesos ($334).

323.title: I don't need to react: Sonam on being trolled for maternity photoshoot
323.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor has opened up about being trolled for her maternity photoshoot and said, "I think...one thing I've grown out of is reacting to things I don't need to react to." "I come from a place of extreme privilege and [I've]...nothing to complain about, so if someone is saying something...from behind a keyboard, [it's]...none of my business," she added.

324.title: I'm not 20, it won't take me anywhere: Meera on doing Kubbra's Sacred Games role
324.article_body: Actress Meera Chopra has stated that she would not be open to doing Kubbra Sait's role of a trans-woman in 'Sacred Games'. "I'm not 20 anymore, I'm not at the age where I would imagine that such a thing would take me somewhere," she said. The actress added that she has also refused offers over being asked to kiss onscreen.

325.title: CWG gold medallist Lakshya enters 2nd round at World Championships 2022
325.article_body: Commonwealth Games 2022 gold medal-winning shuttler Lakshya Sen entered the second round at World Championships 2022 after defeating HK Solberg Vittinghus of Denmark 21-12, 21-11 in Tokyo on Monday. Ninth-seeded Lakshya, who won a bronze medal in the last edition, ended the match in 35 minutes. Earlier, 2019 bronze medallist Sai Praneeth lost in the first round.

326.title: Are other castes of compromising nature?: Agnihotri on Sisodia's remarks
326.article_body: Film director Vivek Agnihotri criticised Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia for his "I am a Rajput" remark. Sharing Sisodia’s statement, he tweeted, "Does this mean had he not been a Rajput, he would have given in? So what about those people in Delhi who are Brahmins, Yadavs, Gujjars, Jats, Sikhs, etc? Are they all of a compromising nature?"

327.title: 1 arrested, 50 booked for assaulting police at concert venue in Kerala
327.article_body: One person has been arrested and 50 others have been booked for assaulting policemen after they shut down a concert at a Kerala beach on Sunday. Police said the venue could not accommodate all the attendees which created a disturbance and overcrowding. Six policemen and 30 members of the public were injured after the accused threw stones and beer bottles.

328.title: Shubman smashes highest-ever ODI score by an Indian in Zimbabwe, breaks Sachin's record
328.article_body: India's 22-year-old opener Shubman Gill on Monday smashed the highest-ever score in ODI cricket by an Indian in Zimbabwe. Shubman scored 130 runs off 97 deliveries, including 15 fours and a six, in the third ODI against Zimbabwe in Harare. The previous record was held by Sachin Tendulkar, who had smashed 127* runs off 130 deliveries in Bulawayo in 1998.

329.title: Blessing in disguise: Snapdeal CEO on old email saying his US visa was rejected
329.article_body: Snapdeal CEO Kunal Bahl shared a 15-year-old email stating his application for H1-B visa in 2007 was rejected by the US government. "I returned to India and couldn't be more thankful that this happened to me," Bahl tweeted. Calling it a "blessing in disguise", he said he got the chance to start his own company, Snapdeal, in his own country.

330.title: Sikh girl abducted, raped and forcibly converted to Islam in Pakistan
330.article_body: A Sikh girl named Dina Kaur was abducted and forcibly converted to Islam on Saturday in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province of Pakistan, ANI reported. She was reported to be abducted on gunpoint, raped and married to her abductor with the help of local administration and police, ANI added. Sikh community in Buner blocked roads and organised massive protests after the incident.

331.title: Cricketers react as Shubman Gill smashes his 1st ODI ton
331.article_body: Reacting to Team India opener Shubman Gill's first-ever hundred in international cricket, Irfan Pathan tweeted, "First of many...for this youngster, well done." Veteran batter Robin Uthappa wrote, "Shubman played some gun shots with panache!! An absolute delight to watch." Shubman scored 130 off 97 deliveries as India posted 289/8 against Zimbabwe in the third ODI.

332.title: Former Pak PM Imran Khan gets protective bail in terrorism case
332.article_body: Islamabad High Court has granted former Pakistan PM Imran Khan protective bail till Thursday after he was booked under the anti-terror act for allegedly threatening two top police officials and a magistrate. This comes after Khan's lawyers filed a petition seeking pre-arrest bail. The petition stated that Khan was a "target of the ruling PDM (Pakistan Democratic Movement)", reported Dawn.

333.title: 'This is a good omen': Alia recalls Gadot's husband's reaction to her pregnancy
333.article_body: Alia Bhatt, who's expecting her first child with Ranbir Kapoor, spoke about how her 'Heart of Stone' co-star Gal Gadot and her husband Jaron Varsano reacted to her pregnancy. She said Gal had a "lovely reaction" while Jaron called it "a good omen". "Jaron was like, 'This is a good omen...everything's gonna go really well, it's lovely for...movie'," Alia said.

334.title: B'luru sees decline in daily COVID-19 caseload, logs 273 new cases
334.article_body: Bengaluru added 273 new cases to its COVID-19 tally with a positivity rate of 6.06% in the last 24 hours, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief informed on Sunday. The city had recorded as many as 965 cases on the previous day. According to data shared by the BBMP chief on Sunday, Bengaluru's active caseload stood at 7,251.

335.title: Request passengers to vote for AAP: Kejriwal to bus drivers in Gujarat
335.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal has asked bus drivers and conductors in Gujarat to request passengers to vote for AAP in the upcoming Assembly elections to bring a change. He also said, "We're guaranteeing that we'll provide free and best health treatment to all Gujaratis...Mohalla clinics and health clinics will be opened in cities and villages."

336.title: History-sheeter injured in encounter with Ghaziabad Police
336.article_body: Ghaziabad Police arrested a man wanted in multiple robbery and attempted murder cases on Sunday following an encounter. The accused tried escaping the site of a routine checking, police said. In the ensuing encounter, he was shot in the leg, as per police. It was revealed during investigation that he is a member of the Deepak Agrola gang, police added.

337.title: WI ruled 2 overs short of target in 3rd NZ ODI, players fined 40% of match fee
337.article_body: West Indies players have been fined 40% of their match fee for maintaining a slow over-rate against New Zealand in the third and final ODI. The sanctions were imposed by match referee Richie Richardson on the hosts, who lost the game by five wickets. With the win, New Zealand also won the three-match ODI series 2-1.

338.title: BJP's 'modus operandi' to topple govts is using central agencies: AAP's Atishi
338.article_body: AAP leader Atishi on Monday said that PM Narendra Modi and BJP’s "modus operandi" to topple governments is to use central agencies. "They first use these agencies...CBI, ED...to lodge cases against leaders (of Opposition parties)…BJP reaches those leaders and offers them to join…party with the promise to close all cases against them," Atishi added.

339.title: Andhra CM Jagan Mohan Reddy meets PM Narendra Modi in Delhi
339.article_body: Andhra Pradesh CM Jagan Mohan Reddy met PM Narendra Modi at his residence today in the national capital. This is his second meeting with the PM in the last three months. He is also expected to meet some of the Union Ministers. He met the PM earlier this year and discussed about many projects including Polavaram, Kadapa Steel Plant, etc.

340.title: Dehradun Police team leaves for Gurugram to arrest Bobby Kataria
340.article_body: A Dehradun Police team has left for Gurugram to arrest social media influencer Bobby Kataria for allegedly having liquor on a road by blocking traffic last month. The police will move court for confiscation of Kataria's property if he is not found, an official said. He added that two notices had already been issued to Kataria earlier this month.

341.title: Ease of doing drug business: Rahul to PM Modi on Guj drug hauls
341.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi on Monday over multiple drug busts from Gujarat and asked for how long he would be silent on the matter. "Drugs worth thousands of crores are reaching Gujarat. Who is spreading this poison in the holy land of Gandhi-Patel," Gandhi said in a tweet in Hindi.

342.title: Mobile phone charger explodes, catches fire in MP; 4-year-old boy injured
342.article_body: A mobile phone charger exploded in the hands of a 4-year-old boy and got stuck in his hand after he grabbed the phone which was charging in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur. The charger got stuck in the boy's fingers and caught fire after the explosion. The child is undergoing treatment and has suffered severe burn injuries on his hand.

343.title: Gunmen kidnapped 4 Catholic nuns on a highway in Nigeria: Convent
343.article_body: A local convent said on Monday that gunmen have kidnapped four Catholic nuns on a highway in Nigeria's Imo. The convent's secretary general said that the abducted nuns had been travelling from Rivers to Imo for a thanksgiving mass. Earlier in June, a lawmaker had said that at least 50 people were killed after gunmen attacked a church in Ondo.

344.title: All the rumours about Kartik Aaryan hiking his fee are baseless: Director
344.article_body: A Bollywood director, who is working with Kartik Aaryan on an upcoming project, has refuted the reports claiming that the 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' actor has hiked up his fee. "Kartik is a very grounded guy in reality...All the rumours about him hiking his fee are baseless," the director on the condition of anonymity said. Kartik will next feature in 'Shehzada'.

345.title: Pune NCP protests over reservation in govt jobs for Govindas
345.article_body: The Pune NCP on Monday staged a protest against Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's announcement over reservation in government jobs for Dahi Handi participants. The protesters said this will be an injustice to those preparing for government jobs. Last week, the CM announced that Govindas playing Dahi Handi will be eligible for government jobs under the 5% sports quota.

346.title: Hyderabad Police to increase number of patrolling vehicles
346.article_body: The Hyderabad Police will be increasing the number of patrolling vehicles at Banjara Hills and Jubilee Hills police stations to reduce the emergency response time due to high number of dial 100 calls received from these areas. The police stations having larger jurisdictions have also been allotted extra quota of fuel for patrol vehicles, Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand said.

347.title: K Kavitha to file defamation case after BJP leaders call her AAP-liquor mafia middleman
347.article_body: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao's daughter and MLC K Kavitha said that she will file defamation case against Delhi BJP leaders Parvesh Verma and Manjinder Singh Sirsa after they said that she acted as a "middleman" between liquor mafia and Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) government. "I don't have any link...with what was said in...Delhi Excise scam," K Kavitha said.

348.title: Wrong judgement of driver: BJP's Fadnavis on ex-MLC's accident
348.article_body: Days after former MLC Vinayak Mete died in a car crash on Mumbai-Pune Expressway, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that it was an "utterly wrong judgement" of Mete's driver. The 52-year-old Shiv Sangram party leader was killed after his car hit a truck on August 14. Police had said that Mete's driver was trying to overtake a truck.

349.title: BJP offered me CM post if I break AAP: Delhi Deputy CM Sisodia
