349.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday alleged that BJP offered him the Chief Minister's post if he broke AAP. He claimed that someone came to him with two offers from BJP. Sisodia added that he was told that all big cases registered against him by CBI and ED would be taken back if he quit AAP and joined BJP.

350.title: Radhakishan Damani likely to be main trustee of Jhunjhunwala's estate: Report
350.article_body: DMart's billionaire owner Radhakishan Damani is likely to be the main trustee of veteran investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's estate, Moneycontrol reported. Damani is said to have the final say in the main publicly listed investments of Jhunjhunwala. The investor, who passed away last week, reportedly left his assets, including investments in listed and unlisted firms, mainly to his wife and children.

351.title: Sensex plunges over 870 points to close at 58,773, Nifty ends below 17,500
351.article_body: Sensex on Monday plunged by 872 points to close at 58,773, whereas the Nifty was down 267 points to settle below 17,500, marking the second consecutive decline for the benchmark indices. Shares of ITC, Coal India, Tata Consumer Products, Nestle India and Britannia Industries were among top Nifty gainers. Meanwhile, Tata Steel, Asian Paints, Adani Ports were among major losers.

352.title: Chiranjeevi is ageless megastar, has same pace & grace: 'Bholaa...' director
352.article_body: Filmmaker Meher Ramesh has said that directing actor Chiranjeevi in 'Bholaa Shankar' was a dream come true for him. "Chiranjeevi is an ageless megastar...No other actor or star has this kind of stardom even after all these years," he added. "Even now he is acting as a lead actor...he is doing it with the same grace and speed," he stated.

353.title: Rhea shares pics of herself crying on seeing Sonam Kapoor’s newborn
353.article_body: Rhea Kapoor on Monday introduced Instagram to her 'nephew' and Sonam Kapoor-Anand Ahuja's son, who was born on August 20. Rhea shared photos of herself in which she can be seen crying at the sight of her newborn nephew. Calling Sonam "the bravest mommy" and Anand "the most loving dad", Rhea described the moment as "unreal".

354.title: 'The Kapil Sharma Show' goes on floors, Akshay is first guest: Reports
354.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma has reportedly started shooting for the new season of 'The Kapil Sharma Show', which he announced on Sunday. As per reports, Kapil is shooting the first episode with Akshay Kumar, who will be promoting his upcoming film 'Cuttputlli' on the show. Along with Akshay, the episode will reportedly feature Rakul Preet Singh and Sargun Mehta.

355.title: KCR’s family attended meetings on formulation of Delhi excise policy: BJP MP
355.article_body: BJP MP Parvesh Verma has claimed that Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao's family members attended meetings on the formulation of the Delhi excise policy at a hotel. "KCR's family members got the same policy implemented in Punjab. They prepared a plan for Delhi along with Manish Sisodia and Arvind Kejriwal," Verma added.

356.title: 55-yr-old kills 11-yr-old girl for reporting his misbehaviour in B'luru
356.article_body: A 55-year-old man killed his 11-year-old neighbour, allegedly after she reported his misbehaviour, before stabbing himself to death in Bengaluru on Sunday, police said. The accused had blocked the girl when she was going down the stairs, following which he had been asked to move out, officers said. He stabbed her after failing to find a place for rent.

357.title: KL Rahul, Rishabh Pant could be India's all-format captains in future: Karim
357.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Saba Karim has named KL Rahul and Rishabh Pant as the players who can become India's all-format captain in the future. "For how long Rohit can continue given his injury woes? So, these things also have to be kept in mind," added Karim. Rahul captained India in a Test and three ODIs against South Africa earlier this year.

358.title: 22-year-old Shubman Gill smashes his first-ever hundred in international cricket
358.article_body: Team India opener Shubman Gill on Monday smashed his first-ever hundred in international cricket. The 22-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 82 deliveries against Zimbabwe in the third ODI. Shubman, who made his international debut in an ODI in 2019, took 30 international innings to record his maiden international ton.

359.title: Shubman breaks Rohit's record, becomes youngest Indian to smash a hundred in Zimbabwe
359.article_body: Opener Shubman Gill has become the youngest-ever Indian to smash a hundred in international cricket on Zimbabwean soil. Gill slammed a hundred in the third ODI against Zimbabwe in Harare aged 22 years and 348 days. He broke the record set by Rohit Sharma, who had slammed an ODI ton in Zimbabwe aged 23 years and 28 days.

360.title: I've made sure I'm the one paying for kids' education: Twinkle Khanna
360.article_body: Actress-turned-author Twinkle Khanna has said that she has always made sure that she is the one paying for her children's education. "I want them to say that my mother paid for my education and not just fed me aloo parathas," she added. Twinkle further revealed she never had a joint account with her husband and actor Akshay Kumar.

361.title: Garcia becomes first-ever qualifier to win WTA 1000 title at Cincinnati Open
361.article_body: Unseeded Caroline Garcia beat two-time Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova 6-2, 6-4 to win Cincinnati Open title on Sunday and became the first-ever qualifier to win a WTA 1000 title. "Don't know how to describe that week because I came here on Wednesday night to get ready for qualifiers," said Garcia. Garcia beat three top-10 opponents en route to the final.

362.title: B'day wishes to my brother whom I love, respect: Pawan to Chiranjeevi
362.article_body: Taking to Twitter, actor Pawan Kalyan wished actor Chiranjeevi on his 67th birthday. "My wholehearted birthday wishes to my beloved brother whom I love, respect and adore," he tweeted. "Wishing you good health, success and glory on this special day," he added. Chiranjeevi will next feature in 'GodFather'.

363.title: Paine returns to Tasmania team after break over sexting scandal
363.article_body: Ex-Australian Test captain Tim Paine is reportedly set to make his competitive cricket comeback in the upcoming Sheffield Shield season. Cricket Tasmania CEO Dom Baker has confirmed that Paine has been training with the state squad. Paine had resigned from captaincy and had taken an indefinite break from all cricket amid his 'd**k pic' scandal last year.

364.title: Man kills 33-year-old wife in front of children over dowry in Hyd
364.article_body: A man killed his 33-year-old wife in front of their children in Hyderabad's Uppal district over a dowry dispute. The deceased had lodged a complaint a few years back and the police helped the couple reconcile. The accused, after having fought with his wife over the same issue, killed her in front of their children and escaped.

365.title: 68,000 candidates register for Agniveer rally at Army's Pune office
365.article_body: As many as 68,000 candidates have registered at the Pune office of the Indian Army for the second Agniveer recruitment rally. The rally is being organised at Mahatma Phule Krishi Vidyapeeth at Rahuri in Ahmednagar from August 23 (Tuesday) to September 11. A daily footfall of around 5,000 candidates is expected, Army officials said.

366.title: US is procrastinating talks to revive 2015 nuclear deal: Iran
366.article_body: Iran's Foreign Ministry spokesperson Nasser Kanaani on Monday accused the US of "procrastinating" indirect talks to revive the 2015 nuclear deal and said that there is "inaction" from the European sides. Adding that the agreement is needed more by the US and Europe than Iran, he also stated that Tehran wanted a "sustainable deal that would preserve its legitimate rights".

367.title: Comedian Kapil Sharma makes ramp-walk debut at Beti Fashion Show
367.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma marked his debut on the ramp as he turned showstopper for Anu Ranjan's Beti Fashion Show over the weekend. Kapil was dressed in a black puff-sleeve jacket, which was paired with black pants featuring gold patchwork. A video shared by Bollywood photographer Viral Bhayani shows Kapil walking the ramp and also imitating female models at the end.

368.title: 2019 bronze medallist Praneeth crashes out of World Championships 2022
368.article_body: Sai Praneeth crashed out of World Championships 2022 in Tokyo after losing in first round on Monday. The 2019 bronze medallist lost to fourth-seeded Chou Tien Chen 15-21, 21-15, 15-21. In women's doubles, Indian duo of Ashwini Ponnappa and Sikki Reddy entered second round with a 21-7, 21-9 win over Maldives' Aminath Nabeeha Abdul Razzaq and Fathimath Nabaaha Abdul Razzaq.

369.title: Akasa Air operates 2 flights daily between Bengaluru & Mumbai
369.article_body: Newly-launched Akasa Air has started operating flights between Bengaluru and Mumbai twice daily. The budget carrier currently operates from Ahmedabad, Bengaluru, Chennai, Kochi and Mumbai. The first Akasa Air flight operated between Mumbai and Ahmedabad on August 7 this year and it also began operations from Bengaluru to Kochi on August 12.

370.title: SC stays Delhi HC order to file FIR against Shahnawaz Hussain in rape case
370.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday stayed a Delhi High Court order to register a First Information Report (FIR) against BJP leader Syed Shahnawaz Hussain in a 2018 rape complaint. "We are prima facie of the view that the matter requires consideration. We will issue notice and stay all proceedings," a Bench led by Justice UU Lalit said.

371.title: Farmers stopped at Ghazipur border, allowed to proceed after due verification: Police
371.article_body: Some farmers who had gathered for protests in the national capital on Monday were stopped at the Ghazipur border, "in view of the heightened security measures and threat perception", police said. "However, after due verifications, all of them were allowed to proceed to their respective destinations," DCP (East district) Priyanka Kashyap added.

372.title: Euro falls to parity with US dollar for the second time this year
372.article_body: The euro briefly slipped below parity with the US dollar on Monday amid fear regarding recession in the euro zone. The currency was trading at exactly $1 after recovering marginally. This is the second time the euro has hit parity with dollar this year. In July, the euro reached parity with US dollar for the first time in 20 years.

373.title: Philippine kids return to schools after 2 yrs as COVID-19 curbs ease
373.article_body: Millions of children returned to classrooms for their first in-person class as all schools were reopened in the Philippines on Monday after two years, as the country eased coronavirus restrictions. In November last year, the country had opened some schools in a pilot project to test in-person classes. Precautions like mandating face masks and temperature checks are in place.

374.title: Vodafone agrees to sell Hungarian unit for $1.8 billion
374.article_body: Britain's Vodafone has agreed to sell its Hungarian business for $1.8 billion in cash as part of its plan to simplify its business. The firm has sold its assets to 4iG Public and state-run Corvinus Zrt. The deal does not include Vodafone's shared services business VOIS and is expected to create Hungary's second largest telecoms operator.

375.title: Mike Tyson punched me by mistake, I had migraine for whole day: Vijay Deverakonda
375.article_body: Talking about boxing legend Mike Tyson who has made a cameo in his upcoming film 'Liger', actor Vijay Deverakonda said Tyson punched him by mistake during rehearsals. "I had migraine for the whole day...I didn’t get knocked out...but body wanted to fall down," he added. "I was worried when I saw his hands, his foot and his neck," he remarked.

376.title: Man shooting video with snake dies after reptile bites him in Uttar Pradesh
376.article_body: A man shooting a video with a snake in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur died after he was allegedly bitten by the reptile. The deceased was reportedly famous in the area for rescuing snakes and had caught more than 200 snakes in the village. The snake with which he was allegedly shooting the video, was caught from his neighbour's house, reports said.

377.title: Mumbai woman mistakenly consumes poison instead of stomach medicine, dies
377.article_body: A 24-year-old woman in Mumbai mistakenly consumed rat poison instead of medicine for stomach ache. She died a week later, police said. The incident took place on August 13 at around 9.30 pm. The deceased had called her mother to tell her that she was vomiting after consuming poison and that she needed help. She was taken to the hospital.

378.title: 'Hera Pheri' producer Abdul Gaffar Nadiadwala passes away aged 91
378.article_body: Veteran producer Abdul Gaffar Nadiadwala, who produced films like 'Hera Pheri' and 'Lahoo Ke Do Rang', passed away aged 91. He reportedly died due to cardiac arrest while being treated at Breach Candy Hospital in Mumbai. Mourning his demise, actor Ajay Devgn tweeted, "Deepest condolences...My father and he were associates during the golden era of our cinema."

379.title: I guess I was too relaxed to lose, it cost me: Tsitsipas on Cincinnati Open final
379.article_body: World number five Stefanos Tsitsipas has said he was "too relaxed" against Borna Coric in the final of the Cincinnati Open. "Coric was obviously the opposite of what I was...Sometimes it makes you not be that much present in the moment when you're too relaxed. It takes away that momentum that you are trying to capture," added Tsitsipas.

380.title: Sanjay Raut’s custody extended till September 5 in land scam case
380.article_body: A special Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) court extended the judicial custody of Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut till September 5 in the Patra Chawl land scam case. The Enforcement Directorate stated that releasing Raut at this time will hamper the investigation since he has great influence and it is possible that he will tamper with the evidence.

381.title: Ford ordered to pay $1.7 billion over pickup truck crash that killed US couple
381.article_body: A jury has ordered Ford Motor to pay $1.7 billion after a US couple was killed in a pickup truck crash in 2014. The couple died after a tyre blew out on a local highway and their 2002 Ford Super Duty F-250 pickup rolled over. Following the crash, the couple's children sued Ford alleging the pickup had a weak roof.

382.title: We're working on the script: Jennifer Grey on 'Dirty Dancing' sequel
382.article_body: Actress Jennifer Grey, speaking about the 'Dirty Dancing' sequel said, "I can't tell you much...but I'll tell you that it will involve Baby (her character in the film)." She further added that they are working on the script for the sequel. She added, "We're going to shoot it in the spring of 2023...it comes out on February 9, 2024."

383.title: 5-km-long jam at Delhi-Noida border due to police checking; pics surface
383.article_body: A five-kilometre-long traffic jam was seen at Noida-Delhi Link Road at Chilla Border amid checking of vehicles by police personnel in wake of farmers' protests in the national capital today. Huge traffic snarls were also reported on Delhi-Meerut Expressway, NH-9 and DND flyway. Delhi Traffic Police said that they have deployed additional traffic personnel to handle the situation.

384.title: Slaves of Gujarat: KTR shares video of BJP leader fetching Amit Shah's sandals
384.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao shared a video in which Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar is seen fetching sandals of Union Home Minister Amit Shah when the latter visited a temple in the state. Reacting to it, Rao said that the people of Telangana are watching the "slaves of Gujarat" and will reverse any attempt to denigrate Telangana's "self-respect".

385.title: Priyanka Gandhi should campaign across India: Hanumantha Rao
385.article_body: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao said that party's General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra should campaign across the country and not only stick to Uttar Pradesh. "If Rahul Gandhi is not available, she should also visit south India to strengthen the party at the ground level," said Rao. He further added that Priyanka should contest from Medak constituency like her grandmother.

386.title: GHMC likely to convert Sardar Mahal into a museum: Reports
386.article_body: According to reports, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) will convert Sardar Mahal into a museum which will display the history of the area. The GHMC is scheduled to meet on August 29 where it is likely to give a nod to the proposal. It is located near Charminar and is one of the historical monuments in Hyderabad.

387.title: 16 trauma care centres set up in Hyderabad
387.article_body: Telangana government has set up 16 trauma care centres and 10 advance life support ambulances on the Outer Ring Road of Hyderabad. Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao appealed to people to spread the word about the life-saving trauma care facility. The government also issued new toll-free numbers (1066/1059102) which can be used during any emergency.

388.title: Man rapes & murders 8-yr-old in Delhi, dumps her body in Yamuna
388.article_body: A 36-year-old butcher has been arrested in Delhi for allegedly kidnapping an 8-year-old girl while she was sleeping at her house, raping her, slitting her throat and dumping her body in the Yamuna. The post-mortem revealed that the accused also disfigured the victim's face using a sharp weapon to destroy her identity. The victim's parents work as labourers.

389.title: Tesla's Autopilot averts 40 crashes/day caused by sudden acceleration: Exec
389.article_body: Tesla's Autopilot Software Director Ashok Elluswamy has said that the firm's Autopilot prevents around 40 crashes per day that would have been caused by sudden unintended acceleration (SUA). He shared instances where drivers misapplied the pedals and were saved by Autopilot. He even shared a video in which he claims the Autopilot saved a man's legs from getting injured.

390.title: 4 members of family killed after car falls into gorge in Himachal
390.article_body: Four members of a family were killed after their car skidded off the road and fell into a gorge in Himachal Pradesh's Chamba on Sunday. The victims were identified as Chamba head post office's postal superintendent Tilak Raj, his wife and teenage children. Villagers said they heard a bang and rushed to the spot but the victims had already passed.

391.title: Islamic State suicide bomber plotting to attack Indian leader detained in Russia
391.article_body: The Russian Federal Security Service (FSB) has said that its officers have detained a suicide bomber, a member of the Islamic State terrorist group, who was plotting an attack in India. Russia said that he "planned to commit a terrorist act by blowing himself up against one of the representatives of the ruling circles of India".

392.title: Thankless task: Russian minister on speculating strategic talks with US
392.article_body: Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergey Ryabkov has said that the possibility of the resumption of strategic talks with US "is far from obvious" given the "recklessly aggressive" policy that Washington is pursuing towards Moscow. Moreover, he added that speculating about prospects for strategic dialogue with US, "especially in the conditions when the Americans broke it off, is a thankless task."

393.title: Sajad Lone warns of hunger strike over voting rights to outsiders in J&K
393.article_body: J&K People’s Conference President Sajad Lone commented on the matter of inclusion of outsiders in J&K electoral rolls. "If we feel there is demographic intervention or the rights of the people of J&K are compromised, then we will sit on hunger strike in front of Parliament in Delhi," Lone said. "We're scared of those implementing the law," he added.

394.title: Farooq Abdullah holds all-party meet over 'inclusion of non-local voters' in J&K
394.article_body: National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah on Monday held an all-party meeting regarding the "inclusion of non-locals as voters" in J&K at his residence in Srinagar. Meanwhile, J&K People's Conference President Sajad Lone opted out of the meeting. "If this effort (all party meeting) was serious, it would not be held under media gaze," Lone said.

395.title: Attack on Salman Rushdie designed to create regime of fear: IMSD
395.article_body: The Indian Muslims for Secular Democracy (IMSD) condemned the attack on 'The Satanic Verses' writer Salman Rushdie and questioned the silence of Muslim organisations. IMSD said in a statement that the attack was designed to create a regime of fear. It added that the silence of Muslims emboldens "Islamophobes to paint the religion as a creed of violence and terror".

396.title: Video shows mob climbing building to catch Hindu man over fake blasphemy case in Pak
396.article_body: A Hindu man in Pakistan was booked in a fake blasphemy case over alleged desecration of Quran, reports said. A video shows hundreds of people around an apartment building and some climbing the building to get hold of Ashok Kumar. The video shows police dispersing the mob by lathicharging. Reports added that a Muslim woman had actually burned the Quran.

397.title: No place for Manish Sisodia in BJP: Parvesh Verma
397.article_body: Delhi BJP MP Parvesh Verma reacted to Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's claim that the BJP had offered to "shut all cases" against him if he quit AAP and crossed over. "Sisodia is not welcomed in BJP and he has no place here," Verma said. Not only BJP but no other party should allow Sisodia to join them, he added.

398.title: FTX's revenue jumped by more than 1,000% in a year, leaked documents show
398.article_body: The revenue of privately held crypto exchange FTX surged more than 1,000% from $89 million in 2020 to $1.02 billion in 2021, according to leaked internal documents. Further, its operating income was $272 million in 2021, up from $14 million a year earlier. FTX saw net income of $388 million last year, up from just $17 million a year earlier.

399.title: Musk lists main goals for Tesla & SpaceX for 2022, says 'will require insane work'
399.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk took to Twitter on Monday to share his two main goals for this year. He said that sending SpaceX's Starship rocket to the Earth's orbit and a wide release of Tesla's full-self driving software are the "two giant kahunas". Musk further noted that the goals will require "insane work by many super talented people".

400.title: It's in his own hands: Shahid Afridi on Kohli's future ahead of Asia Cup
400.article_body: During a question-answer session on Twitter, ex-Pakistan skipper Shahid Afridi was asked about Virat Kohli's future. "It's in his own hands," replied Afridi. The former all-rounder was also asked about his views on Kohli's century drought in international cricket since 2019. "Only tough times can unearth big players," said Afridi. Kohli will return to competitive cricket at the Asia Cup.

401.title: 3 policemen kneel on man & repeatedly kick, punch his face in US; suspended
401.article_body: Three police officers have been suspended in US' Arkansas after a video showing them beating up an alleged suspect went viral. The video shows the officers kneeling on him before punching his face and kicking him repeatedly. One of the officers was also seen slamming his head onto the ground. According to police, the man had assaulted an officer first.

402.title: Massive setback for Pakistan: Inzamam on Shaheen getting ruled out of Asia Cup
402.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq has said that pacer Shaheen Afridi's absence from Asia Cup is a "massive setback" for the Babar Azam-led side. "If you look at the last match against India, Shaheen created pressure right from the very first over," added Inzamam. Shaheen had dismissed KL Rahul, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in their T20 World Cup match last year.

403.title: Teen who was pursuing rape case found dead in canal in UP
403.article_body: The body of a 17-year-old girl was recovered in a canal in UP's Barabanki district on Saturday after she went missing on August 18. The victim told her parents that she is going to meet her lawyer to discuss a rape case she lodged in January. Police suspect she died by suicide and her body has been sent for postmortem.
